The Avatar API is used to manipulate scriptable avatars on the domain. This API is a subset of the {@link MyAvatar} API.

Note: In the examples, use "Avatar" instead of "MyAvatar".

description: Available in:Interface ScriptsClient Entity Scripts

The Controller.Hardware.Application object has properties representing Interface's state. The property values are integer IDs, uniquely identifying each output. Read-only. These can be mapped to actions or functions or Controller.Standard items in a {@link RouteObject} mapping (e.g., using the {@link RouteObject#when} method). Each data value is either 1.0 for "true" or 0.0 for "false".

PropertyTypeDataDescription
CameraFirstPersonnumbernumberThe camera is in first-person mode.
CameraThirdPersonnumbernumberThe camera is in third-person mode.
CameraFSMnumbernumberThe camera is in full screen mirror mode.
CameraIndependentnumbernumberThe camera is in independent mode.
CameraEntitynumbernumberThe camera is in entity mode.
InHMDnumbernumberThe user is in HMD mode.
AdvancedMovementnumbernumberAdvanced movement controls are enabled.
SnapTurnnumbernumberSnap turn is enabled.
GroundednumbernumberThe user's avatar is on the ground.
NavigationFocusednumbernumberNot used.
name: Hardware-Application

description: Get the ID of the entity that the camera is set to use the position and orientation from when it's in entity mode. You can also get the entity ID using the Camera.cameraEntity property.
name: getCameraEntity

returns.description: The ID of the entity that the camera is set to follow when in entity mode; null if no camera entity has been set.

description: Set the entity that the camera should use the position and orientation from when it's in entity mode. You can also set the entity using the Camera.cameraEntity property.
name: setCameraEntity

params.description: The entity that the camera should follow when it's in entity mode.
params.name: entityID

examples: <caption>Move your camera to the position and orientation of the closest entity.</caption>Camera.setModeString("entity");var entity = Entities.findClosestEntity(MyAvatar.position, 100.0);Camera.setCameraEntity(entity);

description: The "far-grab" {@link Entities.ActionType|ActionType} moves and rotates an entity to a target position and orientation, optionally relative to another entity. Collisions between the entity and the user's avatar are disabled during the far-grab. It has arguments in addition to the common {@link Entities.ActionArguments|ActionArguments}.
name: ActionArguments-FarGrab

properties.description: The target position.
properties.name: targetPosition

properties.description: The target rotation.
properties.name: targetRotation

properties.description: If an entity ID, the targetPosition and targetRotation are relative to this entity's position and rotation.
properties.name: otherID

properties.description: Controls how long it takes for the entity's position to catch up with the    target position. The value is the time for the action to catch up to 1/e = 0.368 of the target value, where the action     is applied using an exponential decay.
properties.name: linearTimeScale

properties.description: Controls how long it takes for the entity's orientation to catch up with the    target orientation. The value is the time for the action to catch up to 1/e = 0.368 of the target value, where the     action is applied using an exponential decay.
properties.name: angularTimeScale

description: The "hold" {@link Entities.ActionType|ActionType} positions and rotates an entity relative to an avatar's hand. Collisions between the entity and the user's avatar are disabled during the hold. It has arguments in addition to the common {@link Entities.ActionArguments|ActionArguments}.
name: ActionArguments-Hold

properties.description: The ID of the avatar holding the entity.
properties.name: holderID

properties.description: The target position relative to the avatar's hand.
properties.name: relativePosition

properties.description: The target rotation relative to the avatar's hand.
properties.name: relativeRotation

properties.description: Controls how long it takes for the entity's position and rotation to catch up with     the target. The value is the time for the action to catch up to 1/e = 0.368 of the target value, where the action is     applied using an exponential decay.
properties.name: timeScale

properties.description: The hand holding the entity: "left" or "right".
properties.name: hand

properties.description: If true, the entity is made kinematic during the action; the entity won't lag behind the hand but constraint actions such as "hinge" won't act properly.
properties.name: kinematic

properties.description: If true and kinematic is true, the entity's velocity property will be set during the action, e.g., so that other scripts may use the value.
properties.name: kinematicSetVelocity

properties.description: If true, the entity follows the HMD controller rather than the avatar's hand.
properties.name: ignoreIK

description:
Available in:Interface ScriptsClient Entity Scripts

The AvatarManager API has properties and methods which manage Avatars within the same domain.

Note: This API is also provided to Interface and client entity scripts as the synonym, AvatarList. For assignment client scripts, see the separate {@link AvatarList} API.
name: AvatarManager

description: Used in the PAL for getting PAL-related data about avatars nearby. Using this method is fasterthan iterating over each avatar and obtaining data about them in JavaScript, as that methodlocks and unlocks each avatar's data structure potentially hundreds of times per update tick.
name: getPalData

params.description: The list of IDs of the avatars you want the PAL data for.If an empty list, the PAL data for all nearby avatars is returned.
params.name: specificAvatarIdentifiers

returns.description: An array of objects, each object being the PAL data for an avatar.

description:
Available in:Interface ScriptsClient Entity Scripts

Your avatar is your in-world representation of you. The MyAvatar API is used to manipulate the avatar. For example, you can customize the avatar's appearance, run custom avatar animations, change the avatar's position within the domain, or manage the avatar's collisions with other objects.
name: MyAvatar

properties.description: A synonym for position for use by QML.
properties.name: qmlPosition

properties.description: If true then your avatar is rendered for you in Interface, otherwise it is not rendered for you (but it is still rendered for other users).
properties.name: shouldRenderLocally

properties.description: The target velocity of your avatar to be achieved by a scripted motor.
properties.name: motorVelocity

properties.description: The timescale for the scripted motor to achieve the target motorVelocity avatar velocity. Smaller values result in higher acceleration.
properties.name: motorTimescale

properties.description: Reference frame of the motorVelocity. Must be one of the following: "camera", "avatar", and "world".
properties.name: motorReferenceFrame

properties.description: The Type of scripted motor behavior: "simple" to use the motorTimescale time scale; "dynamic" to use character controller timescales.
properties.name: motorMode

properties.description: The sound that's played when the avatar experiences a     collision. It can be a mono or stereo 16-bit WAV file running at either 24kHz or 48kHz. The latter is down-sampled     by the audio mixer, so all audio effectively plays back at a 24khz. 48kHz RAW files are also supported.

description: Moves and orients the avatar, such that it is directly underneath the HMD, with toes pointed forward.

description: The internal inverse-kinematics system maintains a record of which joints are "locked". Sometimes it is useful to forget this history, to preventcontorted joints.

description: Get the position in world coordinates of the point directly between your avatar's eyes assuming your avatar was in itsdefault pose. This is a reference position; it does not change as your avatar's head moves relative to the avatar position.
name: getDefaultEyePosition

returns.description: Default position between your avatar's eyes in world coordinates.

examples: <caption>Report your avatar's default eye position.</caption>var defaultEyePosition = MyAvatar.getDefaultEyePosition();print(JSON.stringify(defaultEyePosition));

description:
The avatar animation system includes a set of default animations along with rules for how those animations are blended together with procedural data (such as look at vectors, hand sensors etc.). overrideAnimation() is used to completely override all motion from the default animation system (including inverse kinematics for hand and head controllers) and play a set of specified animations. To end these animations and restore the default animations, use {@link MyAvatar.restoreAnimation}.

Note: When using pre-built animation data, it's critical that the joint orientation of the source animation and target rig are equivalent, since the animation data applies absolute values onto the joints. If the orientations are different, the avatar will move in unpredictable ways. For more information about avatar joint orientation standards, see Avatar Standards.
name: overrideAnimation

params.description: The URL to the animation file. Animation files need to be .FBX format, but only need to contain the avatar skeleton and animation data.
params.name: url

params.description: The frames per second (FPS) rate for the animation playback. 30 FPS is normal speed.
params.name: fps

params.description: Set to true if the animation should loop.
params.name: loop

params.description: The frame the animation should start at.
params.name: firstFrame

params.description: The frame the animation should end at.
params.name: lastFrame

examples: <caption> Play a clapping animation on your avatar for three seconds. </caption>// Clap your hands for 3 seconds then restore animation back to the avatar.var ANIM_URL = "https://s3.amazonaws.com/hifi-public/animations/ClapAnimations/ClapHands_Standing.fbx";MyAvatar.overrideAnimation(ANIM_URL, 30, true, 0, 53);Script.setTimeout(function () {    MyAvatar.restoreAnimation();}, 3000);

description: The avatar animation system includes a set of default animations along with rules for how those animations are blended together withprocedural data (such as look at vectors, hand sensors etc.). Playing your own custom animations will override the default animations.restoreAnimation() is used to restore all motion from the default animation system including inverse kinematics for hand and headcontrollers. If you aren't currently playing an override animation, this function will have no effect.
name: restoreAnimation
examples: <caption> Play a clapping animation on your avatar for three seconds. </caption>// Clap your hands for 3 seconds then restore animation back to the avatar.var ANIM_URL = "https://s3.amazonaws.com/hifi-public/animations/ClapAnimations/ClapHands_Standing.fbx";MyAvatar.overrideAnimation(ANIM_URL, 30, true, 0, 53);Script.setTimeout(function () {    MyAvatar.restoreAnimation();}, 3000);

description: Each avatar has an avatar-animation.json file that defines which animations are used and how they are blended together with procedural data(such as look at vectors, hand sensors etc.). Each animation specified in the avatar-animation.json file is known as an animation role.Animation roles map to easily understandable actions that the avatar can perform, such as "idleStand", "idleTalk", or "walkFwd."getAnimationRoles() is used get the list of animation roles defined in the avatar-animation.json.
name: getAnimationRoles

returns.description: Array of role strings.

examples: <caption>Print the list of animation roles defined in the avatar's avatar-animation.json file to the debug log.</caption>var roles = MyAvatar.getAnimationRoles();print("Animation Roles:");for (var i = 0; i < roles.length; i++) {    print(roles[i]);}

description:
Each avatar has an avatar-animation.json file that defines a set of animation roles. Animation roles map to easily understandable actions that the avatar can perform, such as "idleStand", "idleTalk", or "walkFwd". To get the full list of roles, use getAnimationRoles(). For each role, the avatar-animation.json defines when the animation is used, the animation clip (.FBX) used, and how animations are blended together with procedural data (such as look at vectors, hand sensors etc.). overrideRoleAnimation() is used to change the animation clip (.FBX) associated with a specified animation role. To end the animations and restore the default animations, use {@link MyAvatar.restoreRoleAnimation}.

Note: Hand roles only affect the hand. Other 'main' roles, like 'idleStand', 'idleTalk', 'takeoffStand' are full body.

Note: When using pre-built animation data, it's critical that the joint orientation of the source animation and target rig are equivalent, since the animation data applies absolute values onto the joints. If the orientations are different, the avatar will move in unpredictable ways. For more information about avatar joint orientation standards, see Avatar Standards.
name: overrideRoleAnimation

params.description: The animation role to override
params.name: role

params.description: The URL to the animation file. Animation files need to be .FBX format, but only need to contain the avatar skeleton and animation data.
params.name: url

params.description: The frames per second (FPS) rate for the animation playback. 30 FPS is normal speed.
params.name: fps

params.description: Set to true if the animation should loop
params.name: loop

params.description: The frame the animation should start at
params.name: firstFrame

params.description: The frame the animation should end at
params.name: lastFrame

examples: <caption>The default avatar-animation.json defines an "idleStand" animation role. This role specifies that when the avatar is not moving,an animation clip of the avatar idling with hands hanging at its side will be used. It also specifies that when the avatar moves, the animationwill smoothly blend to the walking animation used by the "walkFwd" animation role.In this example, the "idleStand" role animation clip has been replaced with a clapping animation clip. Now instead of standing with its armshanging at its sides when it is not moving, the avatar will stand and clap its hands. Note that just as it did before, as soon as the avatarstarts to move, the animation will smoothly blend into the walk animation used by the "walkFwd" animation role.</caption>// An animation of the avatar clapping its hands while standing. Restore default after 30s.var ANIM_URL = "https://s3.amazonaws.com/hifi-public/animations/ClapAnimations/ClapHands_Standing.fbx";MyAvatar.overrideRoleAnimation("idleStand", ANIM_URL, 30, true, 0, 53);Script.setTimeout(function () {    MyAvatar.restoreRoleAnimation();}, 30000);

description: Each avatar has an avatar-animation.json file that defines a set of animation roles. Animation roles map to easily understandable actions thatthe avatar can perform, such as "idleStand", "idleTalk", or "walkFwd". To get the full list of roles, use getAnimationRoles(). For each role,the avatar-animation.json defines when the animation is used, the animation clip (.FBX) used, and how animations are blended together withprocedural data (such as look at vectors, hand sensors etc.). You can change the animation clip (.FBX) associated with a specified animationrole using overrideRoleAnimation().restoreRoleAnimation() is used to restore a specified animation role's default animation clip. If you have not specified an override animationfor the specified role, this function will have no effect.
name: restoreRoleAnimation

params.description: The animation role clip to restore.
params.name: role

description:
Get the position of the avatar's left hand as positioned by a hand controller (e.g., Oculus Touch or Vive).

Note: The Leap Motion isn't part of the hand controller input system. (Instead, it manipulates the avatar's joints for hand animation.)
name: getLeftHandPosition

returns.description: The position of the left hand in avatar coordinates if positioned by a hand controller, otherwise {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3.ZERO}.

examples: <caption>Report the position of your left hand relative to your avatar.</caption>print(JSON.stringify(MyAvatar.getLeftHandPosition()));

description:

Note: The Leap Motion isn't part of the hand controller input system. (Instead, it manipulates the avatar's joints for hand animation.)

description:
Get the pose (position, rotation, velocity, and angular velocity) of the avatar's left hand as positioned by a hand controller (e.g., Oculus Touch or Vive).

Note: The Leap Motion isn't part of the hand controller input system. (Instead, it manipulates the avatar's joints for hand animation.) If you are using the Leap Motion, the return value's valid property will be false and any pose values returned will not be meaningful.
name: getLeftHandPose
examples: <caption>Report the pose of your avatar's left hand.</caption>print(JSON.stringify(MyAvatar.getLeftHandPose()));

description:
Get the pose (position, rotation, velocity, and angular velocity) of the avatar's left hand as positioned by a hand controller (e.g., Oculus Touch or Vive).

Note: The Leap Motion isn't part of the hand controller input system. (Instead, it manipulates the avatar's joints for hand animation.) If you are using the Leap Motion, the return value's valid property will be false and any pose values returned will not be meaningful.
name: getRightHandPose

description: Increase the avatar's scale by five percent, up to a minimum scale of 1000.
name: increaseSize
examples: <caption>Reset your avatar's size to default then grow it 5 times.</caption>MyAvatar.resetSize();for (var i = 0; i < 5; i++){    print ("Growing by 5 percent");    MyAvatar.increaseSize();}

description: Decrease the avatar's scale by five percent, down to a minimum scale of 0.25.
name: decreaseSize
examples: <caption>Reset your avatar's size to default then shrink it 5 times.</caption>MyAvatar.resetSize();for (var i = 0; i < 5; i++){    print ("Shrinking by 5 percent");    MyAvatar.decreaseSize();}

description: A set of properties that can be passed to {@link Picks.createPick} to create a new Ray Pick.
name: RayPickProperties

properties.description: If this Pick should start enabled or not.  Disabled Picks do not updated their pick results.
properties.name: enabled

properties.description: The filter for this Pick to use, constructed using filter flags combined using bitwise OR.
properties.name: filter

properties.description: The max distance at which this Pick will intersect.  0.0 = no max.  < 0.0 is invalid.
properties.name: maxDistance

properties.description: The ID of the parent, either an avatar, an entity, an overlay, or a pick.
properties.name: parentID

properties.description: The joint of the parent to parent to, for example, the joints on the model of an avatar. (default = 0, no joint)
properties.name: parentJointIndex

properties.description: If "Mouse," parents the pick to the mouse. If "Avatar," parents the pick to MyAvatar's head. Otherwise, parents to the joint of the given name on MyAvatar.
properties.name: joint

properties.description: Only for Joint Ray Picks.  A local joint position offset, in meters.  x = upward, y = forward, z = lateral
properties.name: posOffset

properties.description: Only for Joint Ray Picks.  A local joint direction offset.  x = upward, y = forward, z = lateral
properties.name: dirOffset

properties.description: Only for Static Ray Picks.  The world-space origin of the ray.
properties.name: position

properties.description: Only for Static Ray Picks.  The world-space direction of the ray.
properties.name: direction

description: A set of properties that can be passed to {@link Picks.createPick} to create a new Stylus Pick.
name: StylusPickProperties

properties.description: An integer.  0 == left, 1 == right.  Invalid otherwise.
properties.name: hand

properties.description: If this Pick should start enabled or not.  Disabled Picks do not updated their pick results.
properties.name: enabled

properties.description: The filter for this Pick to use, constructed using filter flags combined using bitwise OR.
properties.name: filter

properties.description: The max distance at which this Pick will intersect.  0.0 = no max.  < 0.0 is invalid.
properties.name: maxDistance

description: A set of properties that can be passed to {@link Picks.createPick} to create a new Parabola Pick.
name: ParabolaPickProperties

properties.description: If this Pick should start enabled or not.  Disabled Picks do not updated their pick results.
properties.name: enabled

properties.description: The filter for this Pick to use, constructed using filter flags combined using bitwise OR.
properties.name: filter

properties.description: The max distance at which this Pick will intersect.  0.0 = no max.  < 0.0 is invalid.
properties.name: maxDistance

properties.description: The ID of the parent, either an avatar, an entity, an overlay, or a pick.
properties.name: parentID

properties.description: The joint of the parent to parent to, for example, the joints on the model of an avatar. (default = 0, no joint)
properties.name: parentJointIndex

properties.description: If "Mouse," parents the pick to the mouse. If "Avatar," parents the pick to MyAvatar's head. Otherwise, parents to the joint of the given name on MyAvatar.
properties.name: joint

properties.description: Only for Joint Parabola Picks.  A local joint position offset, in meters.  x = upward, y = forward, z = lateral
properties.name: posOffset

properties.description: Only for Joint Parabola Picks.  A local joint direction offset.  x = upward, y = forward, z = lateral
properties.name: dirOffset

properties.description: Only for Static Parabola Picks.  The world-space origin of the parabola segment.
properties.name: position

properties.description: Only for Static Parabola Picks.  The world-space direction of the parabola segment.
properties.name: direction

properties.description: The initial speed of the parabola, i.e. the initial speed of the projectile whose trajectory defines the parabola.
properties.name: speed

properties.description: The acceleration of the parabola, i.e. the acceleration of the projectile whose trajectory defines the parabola, both magnitude and direction.
properties.name: accelerationAxis

properties.description: Whether or not the acceleration axis should rotate with the avatar's local Y axis.
properties.name: rotateAccelerationWithAvatar

properties.description: Whether or not the acceleration axis should rotate with the parent's local Y axis, if available.
properties.name: rotateAccelerationWithParent

properties.description: If true, the velocity and acceleration of the Pick will scale linearly with the parent, if available. scaleWithAvatar is an alias but is deprecated.
properties.name: scaleWithParent

description: A Shape defines a physical volume.
name: Shape

properties.description: The type of shape to use. Can be one of the following: "box", "sphere", "capsule-x", "capsule-y", "capsule-z", "cylinder-x", "cylinder-y", "cylinder-z"
properties.name: shapeType

properties.description: The size to scale the shape to.
properties.name: dimensions

description: A set of properties that can be passed to {@link Picks.createPick} to create a new Collision Pick.
name: CollisionPickProperties

properties.description: If this Pick should start enabled or not.  Disabled Picks do not updated their pick results.
properties.name: enabled

properties.description: The filter for this Pick to use, constructed using filter flags combined using bitwise OR.
properties.name: filter

properties.description: The information about the collision region's size and shape. Dimensions are in world space, but will scale with the parent if defined.
properties.name: shape

properties.description: The position of the collision region, relative to a parent if defined.
properties.name: position

properties.description: The orientation of the collision region, relative to a parent if defined.
properties.name: orientation

properties.description: The approximate minimum penetration depth for a test object to be considered in contact with the collision region.The depth is measured in world space, but will scale with the parent if defined.
properties.name: threshold

properties.description: The type of object this collision pick collides as. Objects whose collision masks overlap with the pick's collision groupwill be considered colliding with the pick.
properties.name: collisionGroup

properties.description: The ID of the parent, either an avatar, an entity, an overlay, or a pick.
properties.name: parentID

properties.description: The joint of the parent to parent to, for example, the joints on the model of an avatar. (default = 0, no joint)
properties.name: parentJointIndex

properties.description: If "Mouse," parents the pick to the mouse. If "Avatar," parents the pick to MyAvatar's head. Otherwise, parents to the joint of the given name on MyAvatar.
properties.name: joint

properties.description: If true, the collision pick's dimensions and threshold will adjust according to the scale of the parent.
properties.name: scaleWithParent

description: Adds a new Pick.Different {@link PickType}s use different properties, and within one PickType, the properties you choose can lead to a wide range of behaviors.  For example,  with PickType.Ray, depending on which optional parameters you pass, you could create a Static Ray Pick, a Mouse Ray Pick, or a Joint Ray Pick.Picks created with this method always intersect at least visible and collidable things
name: createPick

params.name: type

params.description: A PickProperties object, containing all the properties for initializing this Pick
params.name: properties

properties.name: name

properties.description: When using {@link Pointers.createPointer}, an optionally defined overlay to represent the beginning of the Ray Pointer, using the properties you would normally pass to {@link Overlays.addOverlay}, plus the type (as a type field). When returned from {@link Pointers.getPointerProperties}, the ID of the created overlay if it exists, or a null ID otherwise.
properties.name: start

properties.description: When using {@link Pointers.createPointer}, an optionally defined overlay to represent the path of the Ray Pointer, using the properties you would normally pass to {@link Overlays.addOverlay}, plus the type (as a type field), which must be "line3d". When returned from {@link Pointers.getPointerProperties}, the ID of the created overlay if it exists, or a null ID otherwise.
properties.name: path

properties.description: When using {@link Pointers.createPointer}, an optionally defined overlay to represent the end of the Ray Pointer, using the properties you would normally pass to {@link Overlays.addOverlay}, plus the type (as a type field). When returned from {@link Pointers.getPointerProperties}, the ID of the created overlay if it exists, or a null ID otherwise.
properties.name: end

properties.description: When using {@link Pointers.createPointer}, an optionally defined overlay to represent the end of the Parabola Pointer, using the properties you would normally pass to {@link Overlays.addOverlay}, plus the type (as a type field). When returned from {@link Pointers.getPointerProperties}, the ID of the created overlay if it exists, or a null ID otherwise.
properties.name: end

description: A set of properties that can be passed to {@link Pointers.createPointer} to create a new Pointer. Contains the relevant {@link Picks.PickProperties} to define the underlying Pick.
name: ParabolaPointerProperties

properties.description: If true, the end of the Pointer will always rotate to face the avatar.
properties.name: faceAvatar

properties.description: If false, the end of the Pointer will be moved up by half of its height.
properties.name: centerEndY

properties.description: If true, the end of the Pointer will lock on to the center of the object at which the pointer is pointing.
properties.name: lockEnd

properties.description: If true, the dimensions of the end of the Pointer will scale linearly with distance.
properties.name: distanceScaleEnd

properties.description: If true, the width of the Pointer's path will scale linearly with the pick parent's scale. scaleWithAvatar is an alias but is deprecated.
properties.name: scaleWithParent

properties.description: If true, the end of the Pointer will rotate to follow the normal of the intersected surface.
properties.name: followNormal

properties.description: The strength of the interpolation between the real normal and the visual normal if followNormal is true. 0-1. If 0 or 1, the normal will follow exactly.
properties.name: followNormalStrength

properties.description: A collection of different visual states to switch between.When using {@link Pointers.createPointer}, a list of ParabolaPointerRenderStates.When returned from {@link Pointers.getPointerProperties}, a map between render state names and ParabolaPointerRenderStates.
properties.name: renderStates

properties.description: A collection of different visual states to use if there is no intersection.When using {@link Pointers.createPointer}, a list of DefaultParabolaPointerRenderStates.When returned from {@link Pointers.getPointerProperties}, a map between render state names and DefaultParabolaPointerRenderStates.
properties.name: defaultRenderStates

properties.description: If this Pointer should generate hover events.
properties.name: hover

properties.description: A list of different triggers mechanisms that control this Pointer's click event generation.
properties.name: triggers

description:
Available in:Interface ScriptsClient Entity Scripts

The Pointers API lets you create and manage objects for repeatedly calculating intersections in different ways, as well as the visual representation of those objects. Pointers can also be configured to automatically generate {@link PointerEvent}s on {@link Entities} and {@link Overlays}.
name: Pointers

description: A trigger mechanism for Ray and Parabola Pointers.
name: Trigger

properties.description: This can be a built-in Controller action, like Controller.Standard.LTClick, or a function that evaluates to >= 1.0 when you want to trigger button.
properties.name: action

properties.description: Which button to trigger.  "Primary", "Secondary", "Tertiary", and "Focus" are currently supported.  Only "Primary" will trigger clicks on web surfaces.  If "Focus" is triggered,it will try to set the entity or overlay focus to the object at which the Pointer is aimed.  Buttons besides the first three will still trigger events, but event.button will be "None".
properties.name: button

description: Adds a new PointerDifferent {@link PickType}s use different properties, and within one PickType, the properties you choose can lead to a wide range of behaviors.  For example,  with PickType.Ray, depending on which optional parameters you pass, you could create a Static Ray Pointer, a Mouse Ray Pointer, or a Joint Ray Pointer.Pointers created with this method always intersect at least visible and collidable things
name: createPointer

params.description: A PickType that specifies the method of picking to use
params.name: type

params.description: A PointerProperties object, containing all the properties for initializing this Pointer and the {@link Picks.PickProperties} for the Pick that this Pointer will use to do its picking.
params.name: properties

returns.description: The ID of the created Pointer.  Used for managing the Pointer.  0 if invalid.

examples: <caption>Create a left hand Ray Pointer that triggers events on left controller trigger click and changes color when it's intersecting something.</caption>var end = {    type: "sphere",    dimensions: {x:0.5, y:0.5, z:0.5},    solid: true,    color: {red:0, green:255, blue:0},    ignorePickIntersection: true};var end2 = {    type: "sphere",    dimensions: {x:0.5, y:0.5, z:0.5},    solid: true,    color: {red:255, green:0, blue:0},    ignorePickIntersection: true};var renderStates = [ {name: "test", end: end} ];var defaultRenderStates = [ {name: "test", distance: 10.0, end: end2} ];var pointer = Pointers.createPointer(PickType.Ray, {    joint: "_CAMERA_RELATIVE_CONTROLLER_LEFTHAND",    filter: Picks.PICK_LOCAL_ENTITIES | Picks.PICK_DOMAIN_ENTITIES | Picks.PICK_INCLUDE_NONCOLLIDABLE,    renderStates: renderStates,    defaultRenderStates: defaultRenderStates,    distanceScaleEnd: true,    triggers: [ {action: Controller.Standard.LTClick, button: "Focus"}, {action: Controller.Standard.LTClick, button: "Primary"} ],    hover: true,    enabled: true});Pointers.setRenderState(pointer, "test");

The Audio API provides facilities to interact with audio inputs and outputs and to play sounds.
name: Audio

properties.description: true if the audio input is muted, otherwise false.
properties.name: muted

properties.description: true if noise reduction is enabled, otherwise false. When enabled, the input audio signal is blocked (fully attenuated) when it falls below an adaptive threshold set just above the noise floor.
properties.name: noiseReduction

properties.description: The loudness of the audio input, range 0.0 (no sound) – 1.0 (the onset of clipping). Read-only.
properties.name: inputLevel

properties.description: Adjusts the volume of the input audio; range 0.0 – 1.0. If set to a value, the resulting value depends on the input device: for example, the volume can't be changed on some devices, and others might only support values of 0.0 and 1.0.
properties.name: inputVolume

properties.description: true if the input audio is being used in stereo, otherwise false. Some devices do not support stereo, in which case the value is always false.
properties.name: isStereoInput

properties.description: The current context of the audio: either "Desktop" or "HMD". Read-only.
properties.name: context

properties.description: Read-only. Deprecated: This property is deprecated and will be removed.

properties.name: isSoloing

deprecated: This function is deprecated and will be removed.

name: setOutputDevice
deprecated: This function is deprecated and will be removed.

description: Enable or disable reverberation. Reverberation is done by the client, on the post-mix audio. The reverberation options come from either the domain's audio zone if used — configured on the server — or as scripted by {@link Audio.setReverbOptions|setReverbOptions}.
name: setReverb

params.description: true to enable reverberation, false to disable.
params.name: enable

examples: <caption>Enable reverberation for a short while.</caption>var sound = SoundCache.getSound(Script.resourcesPath() + "sounds/sample.wav");var injector;var injectorOptions = {    position: MyAvatar.position};Script.setTimeout(function () {    print("Reverb OFF");    Audio.setReverb(false);    injector = Audio.playSound(sound, injectorOptions);}, 1000);Script.setTimeout(function () {    var reverbOptions = new AudioEffectOptions();    reverbOptions.roomSize = 100;    Audio.setReverbOptions(reverbOptions);    print("Reverb ON");    Audio.setReverb(true);}, 4000);Script.setTimeout(function () {    print("Reverb OFF");    Audio.setReverb(false);}, 8000);

description: Configure reverberation options. Use {@link Audio.setReverb|setReverb} to enable or disable reverberation.
name: setReverbOptions

params.description: The reverberation options.
params.name: options

description: Starts making an audio recording of the audio being played in-world (i.e., not local-only audio) to a file in WAV format.
name: startRecording

params.description: The path and name of the file to make the recording in. Should have a .wav extension. The file is overwritten if it already exists.
params.name: filename

returns.description: true if the specified file could be opened and audio recording has started, otherwise false.

examples: <caption>Make a 10 second audio recording.</caption>var filename = File.getTempDir() + "/audio.wav";if (Audio.startRecording(filename)) {    Script.setTimeout(function () {        Audio.stopRecording();        print("Audio recording made in: " + filename);    }, 10000);} else {    print("Could not make an audio recording in: " + filename);}

description: Finish making an audio recording started with {@link Audio.startRecording|startRecording}.
name: stopRecording

name: getRecording

returns.description: true if an audio recording is currently being made, otherwise false.

Entity Methods:

The default scripts implement hand controller actions that use {@link Entities.callEntityMethod} to call entity script methods, if present in the entity being interacted with.

Method NameDescriptionExample
startFarTrigger
continueFarTrigger
stopFarTrigger		 These methods are called when a user is more than 0.3m away from the entity, the entity is triggerable, and the user starts, continues, or stops squeezing the trigger. A light switch that can be toggled on and off from a distance.
startNearTrigger
continueNearTrigger
stopNearTrigger		 These methods are called when a user is less than 0.3m away from the entity, the entity is triggerable, and the user starts, continues, or stops squeezing the trigger. A doorbell that can be rung when a user is near.
startDistanceGrab
continueDistanceGrab
 These methods are called when a user is more than 0.3m away from the entity, the entity is either cloneable, or grabbable and not locked, and the user starts or continues to squeeze the trigger. A comet that emits icy particle trails when a user is dragging it through the sky.
startNearGrab
continueNearGrab
 These methods are called when a user is less than 0.3m away from the entity, the entity is either cloneable, or grabbable and not locked, and the user starts or continues to squeeze the trigger. A ball that glows when it's being held close.
releaseGrab This method is called when a user releases the trigger when having been either distance or near grabbing an entity. Turn off the ball glow or comet trail with the user finishes grabbing it.
startEquip
continueEquip
releaseEquip		 These methods are called when a user starts, continues, or stops equipping an entity. A glass that stays in the user's hand after the trigger is clicked.

All the entity methods are called with the following two arguments:

  • The entity ID.
  • A string, "hand,userID" — where "hand" is "left" or "right", and "userID" is the user's {@link MyAvatar|MyAvatar.sessionUUID}.
name: Controller

properties.description:
Predefined actions on Interface and the user's avatar. These can be used as end points in a {@link RouteObject} mapping. A synonym for Controller.Hardware.Actions. Read-only.
Default mappings are provided from the Controller.Hardware.Keyboard and Controller.Standard to actions in keyboardMouse.json and standard.json, respectively.
properties.name: Actions

properties.description: Standard and hardware-specific controller and computer outputs, plus predefined actions on Interface and the user's avatar. The outputs can be mapped to Actions or functions in a {@link RouteObject} mapping. Additionally, hardware-specific controller outputs can be mapped to Standard controller outputs. Read-only.
properties.name: Hardware

properties.description:
Standard controller outputs that can be mapped to Actions or functions in a {@link RouteObject} mapping. Read-only.
Each hardware device has a mapping from its outputs to Controller.Standard items, specified in a JSON file. For example, leapmotion.json and vive.json.
properties.name: Standard

description: Disable default Interface actions for a particular key event.
name: captureKeyEvents

params.description: Details of the key event to be captured. The key property must be specified. The text property is ignored. The other properties default to false.
params.name: event

examples: <caption>Disable left and right strafing.</caption>var STRAFE_LEFT = { "key": 16777234, isShifted: true };var STRAFE_RIGHT = { "key": 16777236, isShifted: true };Controller.captureKeyEvents(STRAFE_LEFT);Controller.captureKeyEvents(STRAFE_RIGHT);Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {    Controller.releaseKeyEvents(STRAFE_LEFT);    Controller.releaseKeyEvents(STRAFE_RIGHT);});

description: Re-enable default Interface actions for a particular key event that has been disabled using {@link Controller.captureKeyEvents|captureKeyEvents}.
name: releaseKeyEvents

params.description: Details of the key event to release from capture. The key property must be specified. The text property is ignored. The other properties default to false.
params.name: event

description: Disable default Interface actions for a joystick.
name: captureJoystick

params.description: The integer ID of the joystick.
params.name: joystickID

deprecated: This function no longer has any effect.

description: Re-enable default Interface actions for a joystick that has been disabled using {@link Controller.captureJoystick|captureJoystick}.
name: releaseJoystick

params.description: The integer ID of the joystick.
params.name: joystickID

deprecated: This function no longer has any effect.

description: Disable {@link Entities.mousePressOnEntity} and {@link Entities.mouseDoublePressOnEntity} events on entities.
name: captureEntityClickEvents
examples: <caption>Disable entity click events for a short period.</caption>Entities.mousePressOnEntity.connect(function (entityID, event) {    print("Clicked on entity: " + entityID);});Script.setTimeout(function () {    Controller.captureEntityClickEvents();}, 5000);Script.setTimeout(function () {    Controller.releaseEntityClickEvents();}, 10000);

description: Re-enable {@link Entities.mousePressOnEntity} and {@link Entities.mouseDoublePressOnEntity} events on entities that were disabled using {@link Controller.captureEntityClickEvents|captureEntityClickEvents}.

description: Enables or disables the virtual game pad that is displayed on certain devices (e.g., Android).
name: setVPadEnabled

The HMD API provides access to the HMD used in VR display mode.
name: HMD

properties.description: The position of the HMD if currently in VR display mode, otherwise {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3.ZERO}. Read-only.
properties.name: position

properties.description: The orientation of the HMD if currently in VR display mode, otherwise {@link Quat(0)|Quat.IDENTITY}. Read-only.
properties.name: orientation

properties.description: true if the display mode is HMD, otherwise false. Read-only.
properties.name: active

properties.description: true if currently in VR display mode and the HMD is being worn, otherwise false. Read-only.
properties.name: mounted

properties.description: The real-world height of the user. Read-only. Currently always returns a value of 1.755.
properties.name: playerHeight

properties.description: The real-world height of the user's eyes. Read-only. Currently always returns a value of 1.655.
properties.name: eyeHeight

properties.description: The inter-pupillary distance (distance between eyes) of the user, used for rendering. Defaults to the human average of 0.064 unless set by the HMD. Read-only.
properties.name: ipd

properties.description: A scale factor applied to the ipd property value.
properties.name: ipdScale

properties.description: true if the tablet is being displayed, false otherwise. Read-only.
properties.name: showTablet

properties.description: true if the tablet has been opened in contextual mode, otherwise false. In contextual mode, the tablet has been opened at a specific world position and orientation rather than at a position and orientation relative to the user. Read-only.
properties.name: tabletContextualMode

properties.description: The UUID of the tablet body model overlay.
properties.name: tabletID

properties.description: The UUID of the tablet's screen overlay.
properties.name: tabletScreenID

properties.name: homeButtonID

properties.description: The UUID of the tablet's "home" button highlight overlay.
properties.name: homeButtonHighlightID

properties.name: miniTabletID

properties.description: The UUID of the mini tablet's screen overlay. null if not in HMD mode.
properties.name: miniTabletScreenID

properties.name: miniTabletHand

properties.name: miniTabletEnabled

description: Calculate the intersection of a ray with the HUD overlay.
name: calculateRayUICollisionPoint

params.description: The origin of the ray.
params.name: position

params.description: The direction of the ray.
params.name: direction

returns.description: The point of intersection with the HUD overlay if it intersects, otherwise {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3.ZERO}.

examples: <caption>Draw a square on the HUD overlay in the direction you're looking.</caption>var hudIntersection = HMD.calculateRayUICollisionPoint(MyAvatar.getHeadPosition(),    Quat.getForward(MyAvatar.headOrientation));var hudPoint = HMD.overlayFromWorldPoint(hudIntersection);var DIMENSIONS = { x: 50, y: 50 };var square = Overlays.addOverlay("rectangle", {    x: hudPoint.x - DIMENSIONS.x / 2,    y: hudPoint.y - DIMENSIONS.y / 2,    width: DIMENSIONS.x,    height: DIMENSIONS.y,    color: { red: 255, green: 0, blue: 0 }});Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {    Overlays.deleteOverlay(square);});

description: Get the 2D HUD overlay coordinates of a 3D point on the HUD overlay.2D HUD overlay coordinates are pixels with the origin at the top left of the overlay.
name: overlayFromWorldPoint

params.description: The point on the HUD overlay in world coordinates.
params.name: position

returns.description: The point on the HUD overlay in HUD coordinates.

examples: <caption>Draw a square on the HUD overlay in the direction you're looking.</caption>var hudIntersection = HMD.calculateRayUICollisionPoint(MyAvatar.getHeadPosition(),    Quat.getForward(MyAvatar.headOrientation));var hudPoint = HMD.overlayFromWorldPoint(hudIntersection);var DIMENSIONS = { x: 50, y: 50 };var square = Overlays.addOverlay("rectangle", {    x: hudPoint.x - DIMENSIONS.x / 2,    y: hudPoint.y - DIMENSIONS.y / 2,    width: DIMENSIONS.x,    height: DIMENSIONS.y,    color: { red: 255, green: 0, blue: 0 }});Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {    Overlays.deleteOverlay(square);});

description: Get the 3D world coordinates of a 2D point on the HUD overlay.2D HUD overlay coordinates are pixels with the origin at the top left of the overlay.
name: worldPointFromOverlay

params.description: The point on the HUD overlay in HUD coordinates.
params.name: coordinates

returns.description: The point on the HUD overlay in world coordinates.

description: Get the 2D point on the HUD overlay represented by given spherical coordinates. 2D HUD overlay coordinates are pixels with the origin at the top left of the overlay. Spherical coordinates are polar coordinates in radians with { x: 0, y: 0 } being the center of the HUD overlay.
name: sphericalToOverlay

params.description: The point on the HUD overlay in spherical coordinates.
params.name: sphericalPos

returns.description: The point on the HUD overlay in HUD coordinates.

description: Get the spherical coordinates of a 2D point on the HUD overlay. 2D HUD overlay coordinates are pixels with the origin at the top left of the overlay. Spherical coordinates are polar coordinates in radians with { x: 0, y: 0 } being the center of the HUD overlay.
name: overlayToSpherical

params.description: The point on the HUD overlay in HUD coordinates.
params.name: overlayPos

returns.description: The point on the HUD overlay in spherical coordinates.

description: Check whether there is an HMD available.
name: isHMDAvailable

params.description: The name of the HMD to check for, e.g., "Oculus Rift". The name is the same as may be displayed in Interface's "Display" menu. If no name is specified then any HMD matches.
params.name: name

returns.description: true if an HMD of the specified name is available, otherwise false.

examples: <caption>Report on HMD availability.</caption>print("Is any HMD available: " + HMD.isHMDAvailable());print("Is an Oculus Rift HMD available: " + HMD.isHMDAvailable("Oculus Rift"));print("Is a Vive HMD available: " + HMD.isHMDAvailable("OpenVR (Vive)"));

description: Check whether there is an HMD head controller available.
name: isHeadControllerAvailable

params.description: The name of the HMD head controller to check for, e.g., "Oculus". If no name is specified then any HMD head controller matches.

examples: <caption>Report HMD head controller availability.</caption>print("Is any HMD head controller available: " + HMD.isHeadControllerAvailable());print("Is an Oculus head controller available: " + HMD.isHeadControllerAvailable("Oculus"));print("Is a Vive head controller available: " + HMD.isHeadControllerAvailable("OpenVR"));

description: Check whether there are HMD hand controllers available.
name: isHandControllerAvailable

params.description: The name of the HMD hand controller to check for, e.g., "Oculus". If no name is specified then any HMD hand controller matches.

description: Check whether there are specific HMD controllers available.

description: Signal that models of the HMD hand controllers being used should be displayed. The models are displayed at their actual, real-world locations.
name: requestShowHandControllers
examples: <caption>Show your hand controllers for 10 seconds.</caption>HMD.requestShowHandControllers();Script.setTimeout(function () {    HMD.requestHideHandControllers();}, 10000);

name: shouldShowHandControllers

returns.description: true if any script is requesting that HMD hand controller models be displayed.

description: Triggered when a request to show or hide models of the HMD hand controllers is made using {@link HMD.requestShowHandControllers|requestShowHandControllers} or{@link HMD.requestHideHandControllers|requestHideHandControllers}.

examples: <caption>Report when showing of hand controllers changes.</caption>function onShouldShowHandControllersChanged() {    print("Should show hand controllers: " + HMD.shouldShowHandControllers());}HMD.shouldShowHandControllersChanged.connect(onShouldShowHandControllersChanged);HMD.requestShowHandControllers();Script.setTimeout(function () {    HMD.requestHideHandControllers();}, 10000);

The Menu API provides access to the menu that is displayed at the top of the window on a user's desktop and in the tablet when the "MENU" button is pressed.

Groupings

A "grouping" provides a way to group a set of menus or menu items together so that they can all be set visible or invisible as a group. There are two available groups: "Advanced" and "Developer". These groupings can be toggled in the "Settings" menu. If a menu item doesn't belong to a group it is always displayed.
name: Menu

description: Add a new top-level menu.
name: addMenu

params.description: Name that will be displayed for the menu. Nested menus can be described using the ">" symbol.
params.name: menuName

params.description: Name of the grouping, if any, to add this menu to.
params.name: grouping

examples: <caption>Add a menu and a nested submenu.</caption>Menu.addMenu("Test Menu");Menu.addMenu("Test Menu > Test Sub Menu");
<caption>Add a menu to the Settings menu that is only visible if Settings > Advanced is enabled.</caption>Menu.addMenu("Settings > Test Grouping Menu", "Advanced");

description: Remove a top-level menu.
name: removeMenu

params.description: Name of the menu to remove.
params.name: menuName

examples: <caption>Remove a menu and nested submenu.</caption>Menu.removeMenu("Test Menu > Test Sub Menu");Menu.removeMenu("Test Menu");

description: Check whether a top-level menu exists.
name: menuExists

params.description: Name of the menu to check for existence.
params.name: menuName

returns.description: true if the menu exists, otherwise false.

examples: <caption>Check if the "Developer" menu exists.</caption>if (Menu.menuExists("Developer")) {    print("Developer menu exists.");}

description: Add a separator with an unclickable label below it. The separator will be placed at the bottom of the menu.If you want to add a separator at a specific point in the menu, use {@link Menu.addMenuItem} with{@link Menu.MenuItemProperties} instead.

params.name: menuName

params.description: Name of the separator that will be displayed as the label below the separator line.

params.description: Name of the menu to remove the separator from.

params.description: Name of the separator to remove.
params.name: separatorName

examples: <caption>Remove a separator.</caption>Menu.removeSeparator("Developer","Test Separator");

description: Add a new menu item to a menu.
name: addMenuItem

params.description: Properties of the menu item to create.
params.name: properties

examples: <caption>Add a menu item using {@link Menu.MenuItemProperties}.</caption>Menu.addMenuItem({    menuName:     "Developer",    menuItemName: "Test",    afterItem:    "Log",    shortcutKey:  "Ctrl+Shift+T",    grouping:     "Advanced"});

description: Add a new menu item to a menu. The new item is added at the end of the menu.
name: addMenuItem

params.description: Name of the menu to add a menu item to.
params.name: menuName

params.description: Name of the menu item. This is what will be displayed in the menu.
params.name: menuItem

params.description: A shortcut key that can be used to trigger the menu item.
params.name: shortcutKey

examples: <caption>Add a menu item to the end of the "Developer" menu.</caption>Menu.addMenuItem("Developer", "Test", "Ctrl+Shift+T");

description: Remove a menu item from a menu.
name: removeMenuItem

params.description: Name of the menu to remove a menu item from.
params.name: menuName

params.description: Name of the menu item to remove.Menu.removeMenuItem("Developer", "Test");
params.name: menuItem

description: Check if a menu item exists.
name: menuItemExists

params.description: Name of the menu that the menu item is in.
params.name: menuName

params.description: Name of the menu item to check for existence of.
params.name: menuItem

returns.description: true if the menu item exists, otherwise false.

examples: <caption>Determine if the Developer > Stats menu exists.</caption>if (Menu.menuItemExists("Developer", "Stats")) {    print("Developer > Stats menu item exists.");}

params.description: The name of the menu item.

returns.description: true if the option is checked, otherwise false.

examples: <caption>Report whether the Settings > Advanced menu item is turned on.</caption>print(Menu.isOptionChecked("Advanced Menus")); // true or false

description: Set a checkable menu item as checked or unchecked.

params.description: The name of the menu item to modify.

params.description: If true, the menu item will be checked, otherwise it will not be checked.

examples: <caption>Turn on Settings > Advanced Menus.</caption>Menu.setIsOptionChecked("Advanced Menus", true);print(Menu.isOptionChecked("Advanced Menus")); // true

description: Trigger the menu item as if the user clicked on it.

params.description: The name of the menu item to trigger.
params.name: menuOption

examples: <caption>Open the help window.</caption>Menu.triggerOption('Help...');

description: Check whether a menu or menu item is enabled. If disabled, the item is grayed out and unusable.Menus are enabled by default.
name: isMenuEnabled

params.description: The name of the menu or menu item to check.
params.name: menuName

returns.description: true if the menu is enabled, otherwise false.

examples: <caption>Report with the Settings > Advanced Menus menu item is enabled.</caption>print(Menu.isMenuEnabled("Settings > Advanced Menus")); // true or false

description: Set a menu or menu item to be enabled or disabled. If disabled, the item is grayed out and unusable.
name: setMenuEnabled

params.description: The name of the menu or menu item to modify.
params.name: menuName

params.description: If true, the menu will be enabled, otherwise it will be disabled.
params.name: isEnabled

examples: <caption>Disable the Settings > Advanced Menus menu item.</caption>Menu.setMenuEnabled("Settings > Advanced Menus", false);print(Menu.isMenuEnabled("Settings > Advanced Menus")); // false

description: Triggered when a menu item is clicked (or triggered by {@link Menu.triggerOption}).

params.description: Name of the menu item that was clicked.
params.name: menuItem

examples: <caption>Detect menu item events.</caption>function onMenuItemEvent(menuItem) {    print("You clicked on " + menuItem);}Menu.menuItemEvent.connect(onMenuItemEvent);

The Selection API provides a means of grouping together avatars, entities, and overlays in named lists.
name: Selection
examples: <caption>Outline an entity when it is grabbed by a controller.</caption>// Create a box and copy the following text into the entity's "Script URL" field.(function () {    print("Starting highlight script...............");    var _this = this;    var prevID = 0;    var listName = "contextOverlayHighlightList";    var listType = "entity";    _this.startNearGrab = function(entityID){        if (prevID !== entityID) {            Selection.addToSelectedItemsList(listName, listType, entityID);            prevID = entityID;        }    };    _this.releaseGrab = function(entityID){        if (prevID !== 0) {            Selection.removeFromSelectedItemsList("contextOverlayHighlightList", listType, prevID);            prevID = 0;        }    };    var cleanup = function(){        Entities.findEntities(MyAvatar.position, 1000).forEach(function(entity) {            try {                Selection.removeListFromMap(listName);            } catch (e) {                print("Error cleaning up.");            }        });    };    Script.scriptEnding.connect(cleanup);});

params.name: listName

params.name: itemType

params.description: The ID of the item to remove.

returns.description: true if the item was successfully removed, otherwise false. is returned if the list doesn't contain any data.

description:
Enable highlighting for a selection list. If the selection list doesn't exist, it will be created. All objects in the list will be displayed with the highlight effect specified. The function can be called several times with different values in the style to modify it.
Note: This function implicitly calls {@link Selection.enableListToScene}.
name: enableListHighlight

params.description: The name of the selection list.
params.name: listName

params.description: The highlight style.
params.name: highlightStyle

returns.description: true if the selection was successfully enabled for highlight.

description:
Disable highlighting for the selection list. If the selection list doesn't exist or wasn't enabled for highlighting then nothing happens and false is returned.
Note: This function implicitly calls {@link Selection.disableListToScene}.
name: disableListHighlight

params.description: The name of the selection list.
params.name: listName

returns.description: true if the selection was successfully disabled for highlight, otherwise false.

description: Enable scene selection for the selection list.If the Selection doesn't exist, it will be created.All objects in the list will be sent to a scene selection.
name: enableListToScene

params.description: The name of the selection list.
params.name: listName

returns.description: true if the selection was successfully enabled on the scene, otherwise false.

name: disableListToScene

params.description: The name of the selection list.
params.name: listName

returns.description: true if the selection was successfully disabled on the scene, false otherwise.

description:
Available in:Interface ScriptsClient Entity Scripts

The Settings API provides a facility to store and retrieve values that persist between Interface runs.
name: Settings

description: Retrieve the value from a named setting.
name: getValue

params.description: The name of the setting.
params.name: key

params.description: The value to return if the setting doesn't exist.
params.name: defaultValue

returns.description: The value stored in the named setting if it exists, otherwise the defaultValue.

examples: <caption>Retrieve non-existent setting values.</caption>var value1 = Settings.getValue("Script Example/Nonexistent Key");print("Value: " + (typeof value1) + " " + JSON.stringify(value1));  // string ""var value2 = Settings.getValue("Script Example/Nonexistent Key", true);print("Value: " + (typeof value2) + " " + JSON.stringify(value2));  // boolean true

description: Store a value in a named setting. If the setting already exists its value is overwritten, otherwise a new setting is created. If the value is set to null or undefined, the setting is deleted.
name: setValue

params.description: The name of the setting. Be sure to use a unique name if creating a new setting.
params.name: key

params.description: The value to store in the setting. If null or undefined is specified, the setting is deleted.
params.name: value

examples: <caption>Store and retrieve an object value.</caption>Settings.setValue("Script Example/My Key", { x: 0, y: 10, z: 0 });var value = Settings.getValue("Script Example/My Key");print("Value: " + (typeof value) + " " + JSON.stringify(value));  // object {"x":0,"y":10,"z":0}
