description: Triggered when an attempt is made to send your avatar to a specified position on the current domain. For example, whenyou change domains or enter a position to go to in the "Goto" dialog.
name: locationChangeRequired

params.description: The position to go to.
params.name: position

params.description: If true then a new orientation has been requested.
params.name: hasOrientationChange

params.description: The orientation to change to. Is {@link Quat(0)|Quat.IDENTITY} if hasOrientationChange is false.
params.name: orientation

params.description: If true then the request is to go to a position near that specified and orient your avatar to face it. For example when you visit someone from the "People" dialog.
params.name: shouldFaceLocation

examples: <caption>Report location change requests.</caption>function onLocationChangeRequired(newPosition, hasOrientationChange, newOrientation, shouldFaceLocation) {    print("Location change required:");    print("- New position = " + JSON.stringify(newPosition));    print("- Has orientation change = " + hasOrientationChange);    print("- New orientation = " + JSON.stringify(newOrientation));    print("- Should face location = " + shouldFaceLocation);}location.locationChangeRequired.connect(onLocationChangeRequired);

description: Triggered when an attempt is made to send your avatar to a new named path on the domain (set in the domain server'ssettings). For example, when you enter a "/" followed by the path's name in the "GOTO" dialog.
name: pathChangeRequired

params.description: The name of the path to go to.
params.name: path

examples: <caption>Report path change requests.</caption>function onPathChangeRequired(newPath) {    print("onPathChangeRequired: newPath = " + newPath);}location.pathChangeRequired.connect(onPathChangeRequired);

description: Triggered when you navigate to a new domain.
name: hostChanged

params.description: The new domain's host name.
params.name: hostname

examples: <caption>Report when you navigate to a new domain.</caption>function onHostChanged(host) {    print("Host changed to: " + host);}location.hostChanged.connect(onHostChanged);

description: Triggered when there's a change in whether or not there's a previous location that can be navigated to using{@link location.goBack|goBack}. (Reflects changes in the state of the "Goto" dialog's back arrow.)
name: goBackPossible

params.description: true if there's a previous location to navigate to, otherwise false.
params.name: isPossible

examples: <caption>Report when ability to navigate back changes.</caption>function onGoBackPossible(isPossible) {    print("Go back possible: " + isPossible);}location.goBackPossible.connect(onGoBackPossible);

description: Triggered when there's a change in whether or not there's a forward location that can be navigated to using{@link location.goForward|goForward}. (Reflects changes in the state of the "Goto" dialog's forward arrow.)
name: goForwardPossible

params.description: true if there's a forward location to navigate to, otherwise false.
params.name: isPossible

examples: <caption>Report when ability to navigate forward changes.</caption>function onGoForwardPossible(isPossible) {    print("Go forward possible: " + isPossible);}location.goForwardPossible.connect(onGoForwardPossible);

description:
The reasons that you may be refused connection to a domain are defined by numeric values:

Reason Value Description
Unknown 0 Some unknown reason.
ProtocolMismatch 1 The communications protocols of the domain and your Interface are not the same.
LoginError 2 You could not be logged into the domain.
NotAuthorized 3 You are not authorized to connect to the domain.
TooManyUsers 4 The domain already has its maximum number of users.
TimedOut 5 Connecting to the domain timed out.
name: ConnectionRefusedReason

description:
Available in:Interface ScriptsClient Entity ScriptsServer Entity ScriptsAssignment Client Scripts

The Messages API enables text and data to be sent between scripts over named "channels". A channel can have an arbitrary name to help separate messaging between different sets of scripts.

Note: If you want to call a function in another script, you should use one of the following rather than sending a message:

  • {@link Entities.callEntityClientMethod}
  • {@link Entities.callEntityMethod}
  • {@link Entities.callEntityServerMethod}
  • {@link Script.callEntityScriptMethod}
name: Messages

description: Send a text message on a channel.
name: sendMessage

params.description: The channel to send the message on.
params.name: channel

params.description: The message to send.
params.name: message

params.description:
If false then the message is sent to all Interface, client entity, server entity, and assignment client scripts in the domain.
If true then: if sent from an Interface or client entity script it is received by all Interface and client entity scripts; if sent from a server entity script it is received by all entity server scripts; and if sent from an assignment client script it is received only by that same assignment client script.
params.name: localOnly

examples: <caption>Send and receive a message.</caption>// Receiving script.var channelName = "com.highfidelity.example.messages-example";function onMessageReceived(channel, message, sender, localOnly) {    print("Message received:");    print("- channel: " + channel);    print("- message: " + message);    print("- sender: " + sender);    print("- localOnly: " + localOnly);}Messages.subscribe(channelName);Messages.messageReceived.connect(onMessageReceived);Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {    Messages.messageReceived.disconnect(onMessageReceived);    Messages.unsubscribe(channelName);});// Sending script.var channelName = "com.highfidelity.example.messages-example";var message = "Hello";Messages.sendMessage(channelName, message);

description: Send a text message locally on a channel. This is the same as calling {@link Messages.sendMessage|sendMessage} with localOnly set to true.
name: sendLocalMessage

params.description: The channel to send the message on.
params.name: channel

params.description: The message to send.
params.name: message

description: Send a data message on a channel.
name: sendData

params.description: The channel to send the data on.
params.name: channel

params.description: The data to send. The data is handled as a byte stream, for example as may be provided via a JavaScript Int8Array object.
params.name: data

params.description:
If false then the message is sent to all Interface, client entity, server entity, and assignment client scripts in the domain.
If true then: if sent from an Interface or client entity script it is received by all Interface and client entity scripts; if sent from a server entity script it is received by all entity server scripts; and if sent from an assignment client script it is received only by that same assignment client script.
params.name: localOnly

examples: <caption>Send and receive data.</caption>// Receiving script.var channelName = "com.highfidelity.example.messages-example";function onDataReceived(channel, data, sender, localOnly) {    var int8data = new Int8Array(data);    var dataAsString = "";    for (var i = 0; i < int8data.length; i++) {        if (i > 0) {            dataAsString += ", ";        }        dataAsString += int8data[i];    }    print("Data received:");    print("- channel: " + channel);    print("- data: " + dataAsString);    print("- sender: " + sender);    print("- localOnly: " + localOnly);}Messages.subscribe(channelName);Messages.dataReceived.connect(onDataReceived);Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () {    Messages.dataReceived.disconnect(onDataReceived);    Messages.unsubscribe(channelName);});// Sending script.var channelName = "com.highfidelity.example.messages-example";var int8data = new Int8Array([1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13]);Messages.sendData(channelName, int8data.buffer);

params.description: The UUID of the sender: the user's session UUID if sent by an Interface or client entity    script, the UUID of the entity script server if sent by a server entity script, or the UUID of the assignment client    script, the UUID of the entity script server if sent by a server entity script, or the UUID of the assignment client    instance if sent by an assignment client script.

description: The "offset" {@link Entities.ActionType|ActionType} moves an entity so that it is a set distance away from a target point. It has arguments in addition to the common {@link Entities.ActionArguments|ActionArguments}.
name: ActionArguments-Offset

properties.description: The target point to offset the entity from.
properties.name: pointToOffsetFrom

properties.description: The distance away from the target point to position the entity.
properties.name: linearDistance

properties.description: Controls how long it takes for the entity's position to catch up with the    target offset. The value is the time for the action to catch up to 1/e = 0.368 of the target value, where the action     is applied using an exponential decay.
properties.name: linearTimeScale

description: The "tractor" {@link Entities.ActionType|ActionType} moves and rotates an entity to a target position and orientation, optionally relative to another entity. It has arguments in addition to the common {@link Entities.ActionArguments|ActionArguments}.
name: ActionArguments-Tractor

properties.description: The target position.
properties.name: targetPosition

properties.description: The target rotation.
properties.name: targetRotation

properties.description: If an entity ID, the targetPosition and targetRotation are relative to this entity's position and rotation.
properties.name: otherID

properties.description: If an entity JointIndex, the targetPosition and targetRotation are relative to this entity's joint's position and rotation.
properties.name: otherJointIndex

properties.description: Controls how long it takes for the entity's position to catch up with the    target position. The value is the time for the action to catch up to 1/e = 0.368 of the target value, where the action    is applied using an exponential decay.
properties.name: linearTimeScale

properties.description: Controls how long it takes for the entity's orientation to catch up with the    target orientation. The value is the time for the action to catch up to 1/e = 0.368 of the target value, where the    action is applied using an exponential decay.
properties.name: angularTimeScale

description: The "travel-oriented" {@link Entities.ActionType|ActionType} orients an entity to align with its direction of travel. It has arguments in addition to the common {@link Entities.ActionArguments|ActionArguments}.
name: ActionArguments-TravelOriented

properties.description: The axis of the entity to align with the entity's direction of travel.
properties.name: forward

properties.description: Controls how long it takes for the entity's orientation to catch up with the     direction of travel. The value is the time for the action to catch up to 1/e = 0.368 of the target value, where the     action is applied using an exponential decay.
properties.name: angularTimeScale

properties.name: axis

properties.description: The ID of the other entity that is connected to the joint.
properties.name: otherEntityID

properties.description: The local offset of the joint relative to the other entity's position.
properties.name: otherPivot

properties.description: The axis of the other entity that moves through the cone. Must be a non-zero vector.

properties.description: The angle through which the joint can move in one axis of the cone, in radians.
properties.name: swingSpan1

properties.name: swingSpan2

description: The "hinge" {@link Entities.ActionType|ActionType} lets an entity pivot about an axis or connects two entities with a hinge joint. It has arguments in addition to the common {@link Entities.ActionArguments|ActionArguments}.
name: ActionArguments-Hinge

properties.description: The local offset of the joint relative to the entity's position.
properties.name: pivot

properties.description: The axis of the entity that it pivots about. Must be a non-zero vector.
properties.name: axis

properties.description: The ID of the other entity that is connected to the joint, if any. If none is specified then the first entity simply pivots about its specified axis.
properties.name: otherEntityID

properties.description: The local offset of the joint relative to the other entity's position.
properties.name: otherPivot

properties.description: The axis of the other entity that it pivots about. Must be a non-zero vector.
properties.name: otherAxis

properties.description: The most negative angle that the hinge can take, in radians.
properties.name: low

properties.description: The most positive angle that the hinge can take, in radians.
properties.name: high

properties.description: The current angle of the hinge. Read-only.
properties.name: angle

description: The "slider" {@link Entities.ActionType|ActionType} lets an entity slide and rotate along an axis, or connects two entities that slide and rotate along a shared axis. It has arguments in addition to the common {@link Entities.ActionArguments|ActionArguments}.
name: ActionArguments-Slider

properties.description: The local position of a point in the entity that slides along the axis.
properties.name: point

properties.description: The axis of the entity that slides along the joint. Must be a non-zero vector.
properties.name: axis

properties.description: The ID of the other entity that is connected to the joint, if any. If non is specified then the first entity simply slides and rotates about its specified axis.
properties.name: otherEntityID

properties.description: The local position of a point in the other entity that slides along the axis.
properties.name: otherPoint

properties.description: The axis of the other entity that slides along the joint. Must be a non-zero vector.
properties.name: axis

properties.description: The most negative linear offset from the entity's initial point that the entity can     have along the slider.
properties.name: linearLow

properties.description: The most positive linear offset from the entity's initial point that the entity can     have along the slider.
properties.name: linearHigh

properties.description: The most negative angle that the entity can rotate about the axis if the action     involves only one entity, otherwise the most negative angle the rotation can be between the two entities. In radians.
properties.name: angularLow

properties.description: The most positive angle that the entity can rotate about the axis if the action     involves only one entity, otherwise the most positive angle the rotation can be between the two entities. In radians.
properties.name: angularHigh

properties.description: The current linear offset the entity is from its initial point if the action involves only one entity, otherwise the linear offset between the two entities' action points. Read-only.
properties.name: linearPosition

properties.description: The current angular offset of the entity from its initial rotation if the action involves only one entity, otherwise the angular offset between the two entities. Read-only.
properties.name: angularPosition

description:
An entity's physics motion type may be one of the following:

ValueDescription
"static"There is no motion because the entity is locked — its locked property is set to true.
"kinematic"Motion is applied without physical laws (e.g., damping) because the entity is not locked and has its dynamic property set to false.
"dynamic"Motion is applied according to physical laws (e.g., damping) because the entity is not locked and has its dynamic property set to true.
name: PhysicsMotionType

description: Starts playing — "injecting" — the content of an audio file. The sound is played globally (sent to the audio mixer) so that everyone hears it, unless the injectorOptions has localOnly set to true in which case only the client hears the sound played. No sound is played if sent to the audio mixer but the client is not connected to an audio mixer. The {@link AudioInjector} object returned by the function can be used to control the playback and get information about its current state.
name: playSound

params.description: The content of an audio file, loaded using {@link SoundCache.getSound}. See {@link SoundObject} for supported formats.
params.name: sound

params.description: Audio injector configuration.
params.name: injectorOptions

returns.description: The audio injector that plays the audio file.

examples: <caption>Play a sound.</caption>var sound = SoundCache.getSound(Script.resourcesPath() + "sounds/sample.wav");var injector;var injectorOptions = {    position: MyAvatar.position};Script.setTimeout(function () { // Give the sound time to load.    injector = Audio.playSound(sound, injectorOptions);}, 1000);

A keyboard key event.
name: KeyEvent

properties.description: The Qt keyboard code of the key pressed. For a list of keyboard codes, see http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qt.html#Key-enum.
properties.name: key

properties.description: A string describing the key. For example, "a" for the "A" key if the Shift is not pressed, "F1" for the F1 key, "SPACE" for the space bar.
properties.name: text

properties.description: true if a Shift key was pressed when the event was generated, otherwise false.
properties.name: isShifted

properties.description: true if a meta key was pressed when the event was generated, otherwise false. On Windows the "meta" key is the Windows key; on OSX it is the Control (Splat) key.
properties.name: isMeta

properties.description: true if a control key was pressed when the event was generated, otherwise false. On Windows the "control" key is the Ctrl key; on OSX it is the Command key.
properties.name: isControl

properties.description: true if an Alt key was pressed when the event was generated, otherwise false.
properties.name: isAlt

properties.description: true if the key is on the numeric keypad, otherwise false.
properties.name: isKeypad

properties.description: true if the event is a repeat for key that is being held down, otherwise false.
properties.name: isAutoRepeat

examples: <caption>Report the KeyEvent details for each key press.</caption>Controller.keyPressEvent.connect(function (event) {    print(JSON.stringify(event));});

A set of properties that can be passed to {@link Menu.addMenuItem} to create a new menu item. If none of position, beforeItem, afterItem, or grouping are specified, the menu item will be placed at the end of the menu.

properties.name: menuItemName

properties.description: Whether or not the menu item is a separator.

properties.name: shortcutKey

properties.description: A {@link KeyEvent} that specifies a key that triggers the menu item.
properties.name: shortcutKeyEvent

properties.description: The position to place the new menu item. An integer number with 0 being the first menu item.
properties.name: position

properties.description: The name of the menu item to place this menu item before.
properties.name: beforeItem

properties.description: The name of the menu item to place this menu item after.
properties.name: afterItem

properties.description: The name of grouping to add this menu item to.

properties.name: button

description: A quaternion value. See also the {@link Quat(0)|Quat} object.
name: Quat

properties.description: Imaginary component i.
properties.name: x

properties.description: Imaginary component j.
properties.name: y

properties.description: Imaginary component k.
properties.name: z

properties.description: Real component.
properties.name: w

description:
Available in:Interface ScriptsClient Entity ScriptsServer Entity ScriptsAssignment Client Scripts

The Quat API provides facilities for generating and manipulating quaternions. Quaternions should be used in preference to Euler angles wherever possible because quaternions don't suffer from the problem of gimbal lock.
name: Quat

properties.description: { x: 0, y: 0, z: 0, w: 1 } : The identity rotation, i.e., no rotation. Read-only.
properties.name: IDENTITY

examples: Print the IDENTITY value. print(JSON.stringify(Quat.IDENTITY)); // { x: 0, y: 0, z: 0, w: 1 } print(JSON.stringify(Quat.safeEulerAngles(Quat.IDENTITY))); // { x: 0, y: 0, z: 0 }

description: Multiply two quaternions.
name: multiply

params.description: The first quaternion.
params.name: q1

params.description: The second quaternion.
params.name: q2

returns.description: q1 multiplied with q2.

examples: <caption>Calculate the orientation of your avatar's right hand in world coordinates.</caption>var handController = Controller.Standard.RightHand;var handPose = Controller.getPoseValue(handController);if (handPose.valid) {    var handOrientation = Quat.multiply(MyAvatar.orientation, handPose.rotation);}

description: Normalizes a quaternion.
name: normalize

params.description: The quaternion to normalize.
params.name: q

returns.description: q normalized to have unit length.

examples: <caption>Normalize a repeated delta rotation so that maths rounding errors don't accumulate.</caption>var deltaRotation = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0.1, 0);var currentRotation = Quat.ZERO;while (Quat.safeEulerAngles(currentRotation).y < 180) {    currentRotation = Quat.multiply(deltaRotation, currentRotation);    currentRotation = Quat.normalize(currentRotation);    // Use currentRotatation for something.}

description: Calculate the conjugate of a quaternion. For a unit quaternion, its conjugate is the same as its     {@link Quat(0).inverse|Quat.inverse}.
name: conjugate

params.description: The quaternion to conjugate.
params.name: q

returns.description: The conjugate of q.

examples: <caption>A unit quaternion multiplied by its conjugate is a zero rotation.</caption>var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(10, 20, 30);Quat.print("quaternion", quaternion, true); // dvec3(10.000000, 20.000004, 30.000004)var conjugate = Quat.conjugate(quaternion);Quat.print("conjugate", conjugate, true); // dvec3(1.116056, -22.242186, -28.451778)var identity = Quat.multiply(conjugate, quaternion);Quat.print("identity", identity, true); // dvec3(0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000)

description: Calculate a camera orientation given eye position, point of interest, and "up" direction. The camera's negative z-axis isthe forward direction. The result has zero roll about its forward direction with respect to the given "up" direction.
name: lookAt

params.description: The eye position.
params.name: eye

params.description: The point to look at.
params.name: target

params.description: The "up" direction.
params.name: up

returns.description: A quaternion that orients the negative z-axis to point along the eye-to-target vector and the x-axis tobe the cross product of the eye-to-target and up vectors.

examples: <caption>Rotate your view in independent mode to look at the world origin upside down.</caption>Camera.mode = "independent";Camera.orientation = Quat.lookAt(Camera.position, Vec3.ZERO, Vec3.UNIT_NEG_Y);

description: Calculate a camera orientation given eye position and point of interest. The camera's negative z-axis is the forward direction. The result has zero roll about its forward direction.
name: lookAtSimple

params.description: The eye position.
params.name: eye

params.description: The point to look at.
params.name: target

returns.description: A quaternion that orients the negative z-axis to point along the eye-to-target vector and the x-axis to be    the cross product of the eye-to-target and an "up" vector. The "up" vector is the y-axis unless the eye-to-target    vector is nearly aligned with it (i.e., looking near vertically up or down), in which case the x-axis is used as the    "up" vector.

examples: <caption>Rotate your view in independent mode to look at the world origin.</caption>Camera.mode = "independent";Camera.orientation = Quat.lookAtSimple(Camera.position, Vec3.ZERO);

description: Calculate the shortest rotation from a first vector onto a second.
name: rotationBetween

params.description: The first vector.
params.name: v1

params.description: The second vector.
params.name: v2

returns.description: The rotation from v1 onto v2.

examples: <caption>Apply a change in velocity to an entity and rotate it to face the direction it's travelling.</caption>var newVelocity = Vec3.sum(entityVelocity, deltaVelocity);var properties = { velocity: newVelocity };if (Vec3.length(newVelocity) > 0.001) {    properties.rotation = Quat.rotationBetween(entityVelocity, newVelocity);}Entities.editEntity(entityID, properties);entityVelocity = newVelocity;

description: Generate a quaternion from a {@link Vec3} of Euler angles in degrees.
name: fromVec3Degrees

params.description: A vector of three Euler angles in degrees, the angles being the rotations about the x, y, and z    axes.
params.name: vector

returns.description: A quaternion created from the Euler angles in vector.

examples: <caption>Zero out pitch and roll from an orientation.</caption>var eulerAngles = Quat.safeEulerAngles(orientation);eulerAngles.x = 0;eulerAngles.z = 0;var newOrientation = Quat.fromVec3Degrees(eulerAngles);

description: Generate a quaternion from a {@link Vec3} of Euler angles in radians.
name: fromVec3Radians

params.description: A vector of three Euler angles in radians, the angles being the rotations about the x, y, and z    axes.
params.name: vector

returns.description: A quaternion created using the Euler angles in vector.

examples: <caption>Create a rotation of 180 degrees about the y axis.</caption>var rotation = Quat.fromVec3Radians({ x: 0, y: Math.PI, z: 0 });

description: Generate a quaternion from pitch, yaw, and roll values in degrees.
name: fromPitchYawRollDegrees

params.description: The pitch angle in degrees.
params.name: pitch

params.description: The yaw angle in degrees.
params.name: yaw

params.description: The roll angle in degrees.
params.name: roll

returns.description: A quaternion created using the pitch, yaw, and roll Euler angles.

examples: <caption>Create a rotation of 180 degrees about the y axis.</caption>var rotation = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDgrees(0, 180, 0 );

description: Generate a quaternion from pitch, yaw, and roll values in radians.
name: fromPitchYawRollRadians

params.description: The pitch angle in radians.
params.name: pitch

params.description: The yaw angle in radians.
params.name: yaw

params.description: The roll angle in radians.
params.name: roll

returns.description: A quaternion created from the pitch, yaw, and roll Euler angles.

examples: <caption>Create a rotation of 180 degrees about the y axis.</caption>var rotation = Quat.fromPitchYawRollRadians(0, Math.PI, 0);

description: Calculate the inverse of a quaternion. For a unit quaternion, its inverse is the same as its    {@link Quat(0).conjugate|Quat.conjugate}.
name: inverse

params.description: The quaternion.
params.name: q

returns.description: The inverse of q.

examples: <caption>A quaternion multiplied by its inverse is a zero rotation.</caption>var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(10, 20, 30);Quat.print("quaternion", quaternion, true); // dvec3(10.000000, 20.000004, 30.000004)var inverse = Quat.invserse(quaternion);Quat.print("inverse", inverse, true); // dvec3(1.116056, -22.242186, -28.451778)var identity = Quat.multiply(inverse, quaternion);Quat.print("identity", identity, true); // dvec3(0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000)

description: Get the "front" direction that the camera would face if its orientation was set to the quaternion value.This is a synonym for {@link Quat(0).getForward|Quat.getForward}.The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getFront

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: The negative z-axis rotated by orientation.

description: Get the "forward" direction that the camera would face if its orientation was set to the quaternion value.This is a synonym for {@link Quat(0).getFront|Quat.getFront}.The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getForward

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: The negative z-axis rotated by orientation.

examples: <caption>Demonstrate that the "forward" vector is for the negative z-axis.</caption>var forward = Quat.getForward(Quat.IDENTITY);print(JSON.stringify(forward)); // {"x":0,"y":0,"z":-1}

description: Get the "right" direction that the camera would have if its orientation was set to the quaternion value.The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getRight

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: The x-axis rotated by orientation.

description: Get the "up" direction that the camera would have if its orientation was set to the quaternion value.The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getUp

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: The y-axis rotated by orientation.

description: Calculate the Euler angles for the quaternion, in degrees. (The "safe" in the name signifies that the angle results willnot be garbage even when the rotation is particularly difficult to decompose with pitches around +/-90 degrees.)
name: safeEulerAngles

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: A {@link Vec3} of Euler angles for the orientation, in degrees, the angles being the rotations about the x, y, and z axes.

examples: <caption>Report the camera yaw.</caption>var eulerAngles = Quat.safeEulerAngles(Camera.orientation);print("Camera yaw: " + eulerAngles.y);

description: Generate a quaternion given an angle to rotate through and an axis to rotate about.
name: angleAxis

params.description: The angle to rotate through, in degrees.
params.name: angle

params.description: The unit axis to rotate about.
params.name: axis

returns.description: A quaternion that is a rotation through angle degrees about the axis. WARNING: This value is in degrees whereas the value returned by {@link Quat(0).angle|Quat.angle} is in radians.

examples: <caption>Calculate a rotation of 90 degrees about the direction your camera is looking.</caption>var rotation = Quat.angleAxis(90, Quat.getForward(Camera.orientation));

description: Get the rotation axis for a quaternion.
name: axis

params.description: The quaternion.
params.name: q

returns.description: The normalized rotation axis for q.

examples: <caption>Get the rotation axis of a quaternion.</caption>var forward = Quat.getForward(Camera.orientation);var rotation = Quat.angleAxis(90, forward);var axis = Quat.axis(rotation);print("Forward: " + JSON.stringify(forward));print("Axis: " + JSON.stringify(axis)); // Same value as forward.

description: Get the rotation angle for a quaternion.
name: angle

params.description: The quaternion.
params.name: q

returns.description: The rotation angle for q, in radians. WARNING: This value is in radians whereas the value used by {@link Quat(0).angleAxis|Quat.angleAxis} is in degrees.

examples: <caption>Get the rotation angle of a quaternion.</caption>var forward = Quat.getForward(Camera.orientation);var rotation = Quat.angleAxis(90, forward);var angle = Quat.angle(rotation);print("Angle: " + angle * 180 / Math.PI);  // 90 degrees.

description: Compute a spherical linear interpolation between two rotations, safely handling two rotations that are very similar.See also, {@link Quat(0).slerp|Quat.slerp}.
name: mix

params.description: The beginning rotation.
params.name: q1

params.description: The ending rotation.
params.name: q2

params.description: The mixture coefficient between 0.0 and 1.0. Specifies the proportion of q2's value to return in favor of q1's value. A value of 0.0 returns q1's value; 1.0 returns q2s's value.
params.name: alpha

returns.description: A spherical linear interpolation between rotations q1 and q2.

examples: <caption>Animate between one rotation and another.</caption>var dt = amountOfTimeThatHasPassed;var mixFactor = amountOfTimeThatHasPassed / TIME_TO_COMPLETE;if (mixFactor > 1) {    mixFactor = 1;}var newRotation = Quat.mix(startRotation, endRotation, mixFactor);

description: Compute a spherical linear interpolation between two rotations, for rotations that are not very similar.See also, {@link Quat(0).mix|Quat.mix}.
name: slerp

params.description: The beginning rotation.
params.name: q1

params.description: The ending rotation.
params.name: q2

params.description: The mixture coefficient between 0.0 and 1.0. Specifies the proportion of q2's value to return in favor of q1's value. A value of 0.0 returns q1's value; 1.0 returns q2s's value.
params.name: alpha

returns.description: A spherical linear interpolation between rotations q1 and q2.

description: Compute a spherical quadrangle interpolation between two rotations along a path oriented toward two other rotations. Equivalent to: Quat.slerp(Quat.slerp(q1, q2, alpha), Quat.slerp(s1, s2, alpha), 2 * alpha * (1.0 - alpha)).
name: squad

params.description: Initial rotation.
params.name: q1

params.description: Final rotation.
params.name: q2

params.description: First control point.
params.name: s1

params.description: Second control point.
params.name: s2

params.description: The mixture coefficient between 0.0 and 1.0. A value of 0.0 returns q1's value; 1.0 returns q2s's value.
params.name: alpha

returns.description: A spherical quadrangle interpolation between rotations q1 and q2 using control points s1 and s2.

description: Calculate the dot product of two quaternions. The closer the quaternions are to each other the more non-zero the value is(either positive or negative). Identical unit rotations have a dot product of +/- 1.
name: dot

params.description: The first quaternion.
params.name: q1

params.description: The second quaternion.
params.name: q2

returns.description: The dot product of q1 and q2.

examples: <caption>Testing unit quaternions for equality.</caption>var q1 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 0);var q2 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 0);print(Quat.equal(q1, q2)); // truevar q3 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 359.95);print(Quat.equal(q1, q3)); // falsevar dot = Quat.dot(q1, q3);print(dot); // -0.9999999403953552var equal = Math.abs(1 - Math.abs(dot)) < 0.000001;print(equal); // true

description: Print to the program log a text label followed by a quaternion's pitch, yaw, and roll Euler angles.
name: print

params.description: The label to print.
params.name: label

params.description: The quaternion to print.
params.name: q

params.description: If true the angle values are printed in degrees, otherwise they are printed in radians.
params.name: asDegrees

examples: <caption>Two ways of printing a label plus a quaternion's Euler angles.</caption>var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 45, 0);// Quaternion: dvec3(0.000000, 45.000004, 0.000000)Quat.print("Quaternion:", quaternion,  true);// Quaternion: {"x":0,"y":45.000003814697266,"z":0}print("Quaternion: " + JSON.stringify(Quat.safeEulerAngles(quaternion)));

description: Test whether two quaternions are equal. Note: The quaternions must be exactly equal in order for true to be returned; it is often better to use {@link Quat(0).dot|Quat.dot} and test for closeness to +/-1.
name: equal

params.description: The first quaternion.
params.name: q1

params.description: The second quaternion.
params.name: q2

returns.description: true if the quaternions are equal, otherwise false.

examples: <caption>Testing unit quaternions for equality.</caption>var q1 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 0);var q2 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 0);print(Quat.equal(q1, q2)); // truevar q3 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 359.95);print(Quat.equal(q1, q3)); // falsevar dot = Quat.dot(q1, q3);print(dot); // -0.9999999403953552var equal = Math.abs(1 - Math.abs(dot)) < 0.000001;print(equal); // true

description: Cancels out the roll and pitch component of a quaternion so that its completely horizontal with a yaw pointing in the given quaternion's direction.
name: cancelOutRollAndPitch

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: orientation with its roll and pitch canceled out.

examples: <caption>Two ways of calculating a camera orientation in the x-z plane with a yaw pointing in the direction of    a given quaternion.</caption>var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(10, 20, 30);var noRollOrPitch = Quat.cancelOutRollAndPitch(quaternion);Quat.print("", noRollOrPitch, true); // dvec3(0.000000, 22.245995, 0.000000)var front = Quat.getFront(quaternion);var lookAt = Quat.lookAtSimple(Vec3.ZERO, { x: front.x, y: 0, z: front.z });Quat.print("", lookAt, true); // dvec3(0.000000, 22.245996, 0.000000)

description: Cancels out the roll component of a quaternion so that its horizontal axis is level.
name: cancelOutRoll

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: orientation with its roll canceled out.

examples: <caption>Two ways of calculating a camera orientation that points in the direction of a given quaternion but    keeps the camera's horizontal axis level.</caption>var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(10, 20, 30);var noRoll = Quat.cancelOutRoll(quaternion);Quat.print("", noRoll, true); // dvec3(-1.033004, 22.245996, -0.000000)var front = Quat.getFront(quaternion);var lookAt = Quat.lookAtSimple(Vec3.ZERO, front);Quat.print("", lookAt, true); // dvec3(-1.033004, 22.245996, -0.000000)

Plays — "injects" — the content of an audio file. Used in the {@link Audio} API.
name: AudioInjector

properties.description: true if the audio is currently playing, otherwise false. Read-only.
properties.name: playing

properties.description: The loudness in the last frame of audio, range 0.0 – 1.0. Read-only.
properties.name: loudness

properties.description: Configures how the injector plays the audio.
properties.name: options

description: Stop current playback, if any, and start playing from the beginning.
name: restart

description: Stop audio playback.
name: stop
examples: <caption>Stop playing a sound before it finishes.</caption>var sound = SoundCache.getSound(Script.resourcesPath() + "sounds/sample.wav");var injector;var injectorOptions = {    position: MyAvatar.position};Script.setTimeout(function () { // Give the sound time to load.    injector = Audio.playSound(sound, injectorOptions);}, 1000);Script.setTimeout(function () {    injector.stop();}, 2000);

description: Get the current configuration of the audio injector.
name: getOptions

returns.description: Configuration of how the injector plays the audio.

description: Configure how the injector plays the audio.
name: setOptions

params.description: Configuration of how the injector plays the audio.
params.name: options

description: Get the loudness of the most recent frame of audio played.
name: getLoudness

returns.description: The loudness of the most recent frame of audio played, range 0.0 – 1.0.

description: Get whether or not the audio is currently playing.
name: isPlaying

returns.description: true if the audio is currently playing, otherwise false.

examples: <caption>See if a sound is playing.</caption>var sound = SoundCache.getSound(Script.resourcesPath() + "sounds/sample.wav");var injector;var injectorOptions = {    position: MyAvatar.position};Script.setTimeout(function () { // Give the sound time to load.    injector = Audio.playSound(sound, injectorOptions);}, 1000);Script.setTimeout(function () {    print("Sound is playing: " + injector.isPlaying());}, 2000);

description: Triggered when the audio has finished playing.
name: finished
examples: <caption>Report when a sound has finished playing.</caption>var sound = SoundCache.getSound(Script.resourcesPath() + "sounds/sample.wav");var injector;var injectorOptions = {    position: MyAvatar.position};Script.setTimeout(function () { // Give the sound time to load.    injector = Audio.playSound(sound, injectorOptions);    injector.finished.connect(function () {        print("Finished playing sound");    });}, 1000);

description: Stop audio playback. (Synonym of {@link AudioInjector.stop|stop}.)
name: stopInjectorImmediately

description: Available in:Interface ScriptsClient Entity ScriptsServer Entity ScriptsAssignment Client Scripts

Triggered when the script starts for a user.

Note: Can only be connected to via this.preload = function (...) { ... } in the entity script.

Available in:Client Entity ScriptsServer Entity Scripts
name: preload

params.description: The ID of the entity that the script is running in.
params.name: entityID

examples: <caption>Get the ID of the entity that a client entity script is running in.</caption>var entityScript = (function () {    this.entityID = Uuid.NULL;    this.preload = function (entityID) {        this.entityID = entityID;        print("Entity ID: " + this.entityID);    };);var entityID = Entities.addEntity({    type: "Box",    position: Vec3.sum(MyAvatar.position, Vec3.multiplyQbyV(MyAvatar.orientation, { x: 0, y: 0, z: -5 })),    dimensions: { x: 0.5, y: 0.5, z: 0.5 },    color: { red: 255, green: 0, blue: 0 },    script: "(" + entityScript + ")",  // Could host the script on a Web server instead.    lifetime: 300  // Delete after 5 minutes.});

params.description: The URL of the script to load. Can be relative to the current script.
params.name: filename

examples: <caption>Load a script from another script.</caption>// First file: scriptA.jsprint("This is script A");// Second file: scriptB.jsprint("This is script B");Script.load("scriptA.js");// If you run scriptB.js you should see both scripts in the running scripts list.// And you should see the following output:// This is script B// This is script A

description: Include JavaScript from other files in the current script. If a callback is specified the files are loaded and included asynchronously, otherwise they are included synchronously (i.e., script execution blocks while the files are included).
name: include

params.description: The URLs of the scripts to include. Each can be relative to the current script.
params.name: filenames

params.description: The function to call back when the scripts have been included. Can be an in-line function or the name of a function.
params.name: callback

description: Include JavaScript from another file in the current script. If a callback is specified the file is loaded and included asynchronously, otherwise it is included synchronously (i.e., script execution blocks while the file is included).
name: include

params.description: The URL of the script to include. Can be relative to the current script.
params.name: filename

params.description: The function to call back when the script has been included. Can be an in-line function or the name of a function.
params.name: callback

examples: <caption>Include a script file asynchronously.</caption>// First file: scriptA.jsprint("This is script A");// Second file: scriptB.jsprint("This is script B");Script.include("scriptA.js", function () {    print("Script A has been included");});// If you run scriptB.js you should see only scriptB.js in the running scripts list.// And you should see the following output:// This is script B// This is script A// Script A has been included

description: Call a function at a set interval.
name: setInterval

params.description: The function to call. Can be an in-line function or the name of a function.
params.name: function

params.description: The interval at which to call the function, in ms.
params.name: interval

returns.description: A handle to the interval timer. Can be used by {@link Script.clearInterval}.

examples: <caption>Print a message every second.</caption>Script.setInterval(function () {    print("Timer fired");}, 1000);

description: Call a function after a delay.
name: setTimeout

params.description: The function to call. Can be an in-line function or the name of a function.
params.name: function

params.description: The delay after which to call the function, in ms.
params.name: timeout

returns.description: A handle to the timeout timer. Can be used by {@link Script.clearTimeout}.

examples: <caption>Print a message after a second.</caption>Script.setTimeout(function () {    print("Timer fired");}, 1000);

description: Stop an interval timer set by {@link Script.setInterval|setInterval}.
name: clearInterval

params.description: The interval timer to clear.
params.name: timer

examples: <caption>Stop an interval timer.</caption>// Print a message every second.var timer = Script.setInterval(function () {    print("Timer fired");}, 1000);// Stop the timer after 10 seconds.Script.setTimeout(function () {    print("Stop timer");    Script.clearInterval(timer);}, 10000);

description: Clear a timeout timer set by {@link Script.setTimeout|setTimeout}.
name: clearTimeout

params.description: The timeout timer to clear.
params.name: timer

examples: <caption>Stop a timeout timer.</caption>// Print a message after two seconds.var timer = Script.setTimeout(function () {    print("Timer fired");}, 2000);// Uncomment the following line to stop the timer from firing.//Script.clearTimeout(timer);

description: Resolve a relative path to an absolute path.
name: resolvePath

params.description: The relative path to resolve.
params.name: path

returns.description: The absolute path.

description: Triggered regularly at a system-determined frequency.
name: update

params.description: The time since the last update, in s.
params.name: deltaTime

description: Triggered when the script is ending.
name: scriptEnding
examples: Connect to the scriptEnding signal. print("Script started"); Script.scriptEnding.connect(function () { print("Script ending"); }); Script.setTimeout(function () { print("Stopping script"); Script.stop(); }, 1000);

A UUID (Universally Unique IDentifier) is used to uniquely identify entities, overlays, avatars, and the like. It is represented in JavaScript as a string in the format, {nnnnnnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnnnnnnnnnn}, where the "n"s are hexadecimal digits.
name: Uuid

description: Generates a UUID from a string representation of the UUID.
name: fromString

params.description: A string representation of a UUID. The curly braces are optional.
params.name: string

returns.description: A UUID if the given string is valid, null otherwise.

examples: <caption>Valid and invalid parameters.</caption>var uuid = Uuid.fromString("{527c27ea-6d7b-4b47-9ae2-b3051d50d2cd}");print(uuid); // {527c27ea-6d7b-4b47-9ae2-b3051d50d2cd}uuid = Uuid.fromString("527c27ea-6d7b-4b47-9ae2-b3051d50d2cd");print(uuid); // {527c27ea-6d7b-4b47-9ae2-b3051d50d2cd}uuid = Uuid.fromString("527c27ea");print(uuid); // null

description: Generates a string representation of a UUID. However, because UUIDs are represented in JavaScript as strings, this is ineffect a no-op.
name: toString

params.description: The UUID to generate a string from.
params.name: id

returns.description: - A string representation of the UUID.

description: Generate a new UUID.
name: generate

returns.description: A new UUID.

examples: <caption>Generate a new UUID and reports its JavaScript type.</caption>var uuid = Uuid.generate();print(uuid);        // {nnnnnnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnnnnnnnnnn}print(typeof uuid); // string

description: Test whether two given UUIDs are equal.
name: isEqual

params.description: The first UUID to compare.
params.name: idA

params.description: The second UUID to compare.
params.name: idB

returns.description: true if the two UUIDs are equal, otherwise false.

examples: Demonstrate true and false cases. var uuidA = Uuid.generate(); var uuidB = Uuid.generate(); print(Uuid.isEqual(uuidA, uuidB)); // false uuidB = uuidA; print(Uuid.isEqual(uuidA, uuidB)); // true

description: Test whether a given UUID is null.
name: isNull

params.description: The UUID to test.
params.name: id

returns.description: true if the UUID equals Uuid.NULL or is null, otherwise false.

examples: Demonstrate true and false cases. var uuid; // undefined print(Uuid.isNull(uuid)); // false uuid = Uuid.generate(); print(Uuid.isNull(uuid)); // false uuid = Uuid.NULL; print(Uuid.isNull(uuid)); // true uuid = null; print(Uuid.isNull(uuid)); // true

description: Print to the program log a text label followed by the UUID value.
name: print

params.description: The label to print.
params.name: label

params.description: The UUID to print.
params.name: id

examples: <caption>Two ways of printing a label plus UUID.</caption>var uuid = Uuid.generate();Uuid.print("Generated UUID:", uuid); // Generated UUID: {nnnnnnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnnnnnnnnnn}print("Generated UUID: " + uuid);    // Generated UUID: {nnnnnnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnnnnnnnnnn}

description: A display or device touch event.
name: TouchEvent

properties.description: Integer x-coordinate of the average position of the touch events.
properties.name: x

properties.description: Integer y-coordinate of the average position of the touch events.
properties.name: y

properties.description: true if the touch point has just been pressed, otherwise false.
properties.name: isPressed

properties.description: true if the touch point has moved, otherwise false.
properties.name: isMoved

properties.description: true if the touch point has not moved, otherwise false.
properties.name: isStationary

properties.description: true if the touch point has just been released, otherwise false.
properties.name: isReleased

properties.description: true if the Shift key was pressed when the event was generated, otherwise false.
properties.name: isShifted

properties.description: true if the "meta" key was pressed when the event was generated, otherwise false. On Windows the "meta" key is the Windows key; on OSX it is the Control (Splat) key.
properties.name: isMeta

properties.description: true if the "control" key was pressed when the event was generated, otherwise false. On Windows the "control" key is the Ctrl key; on OSX it is the Command key.
properties.name: isControl

properties.description: true if the Alt key was pressed when the event was generated, otherwise false.
properties.name: isAlt

properties.description: Integer number of touch points.
properties.name: touchPoints

properties.description: The coordinates of the touch points.
properties.name: points

properties.description: The radius of a circle centered on their average position that encompasses the touch points.
properties.name: radius

properties.description: true if the radius has reduced since the most recent touch event with a different radius value, otherwise false.
properties.name: isPinching

properties.description: true if the radius has increased since the most recent touch event with a different radius value, otherwise false.
properties.name: isPinchOpening

properties.description: An angle calculated from the touch points, in degrees.
properties.name: angle

properties.description: The change in the angle value since the previous touch event, in degrees, if the number of touch points is the same, otherwise 0.0.
properties.name: deltaAngle

properties.description: The angles of each touch point about the center of all the touch points, in degrees.
properties.name: angles

properties.description: true if the angle of the touch event has changed since the previous touch event and the number of touch points is the same, otherwise false.
properties.name: isRotating

properties.description: "clockwise" or "counterClockwise" if the angle of the touch event has changed since the previous touch event and the number of touch points is the same, otherwise "none".
properties.name: rotating

examples: <caption>Report the TouchEvent details when a touch event starts.</caption>Controller.touchBeginEvent.connect(function (event) {    print(JSON.stringify(event));});

name: Users

properties.description: true if the domain server allows the node or avatar to kick (ban) avatars, otherwise false. Read-only.
properties.name: canKick

properties.description: true if the avatar requests extra data from the mixers (such as positional data of an avatar you've ignored). Read-only.
properties.name: requestsDomainListData

description: Available in:Interface ScriptsClient Entity ScriptsAssignment Client Scripts
Personally ignore another user, making them disappear for you and you disappear for them.
name: ignore

params.description: The node or session ID of the user you want to ignore.
params.name: nodeID

params.description: True for ignored; false for un-ignored.
params.name: enable

description: Get whether or not you have ignored the node with the given UUID.
name: getIgnoreStatus

params.description: The node or session ID of the user whose ignore status you want.
params.name: nodeID

description: Mute another user for you and you only. They won't be able to hear you, and you won't be able to hear them.
name: personalMute

params.description: The node or session ID of the user you want to mute.
params.name: nodeID

params.description: True for enabled; false for disabled.
params.name: muteEnabled

description: Get whether or not you have personally muted the node with the given UUID.

description: Sets an avatar's gain for you and you only.Units are Decibels (dB)
name: setAvatarGain

params.description: The node or session ID of the user whose gain you want to modify, or null to set the master gain.
params.name: nodeID

params.description: The gain of the avatar you'd like to set. Units are dB.

returns.description: gain (in dB)

description: Kick/ban another user. Removes them from the server and prevents them from returning. Bans by either user name (if available) or machine fingerprint otherwise. This will only do anything if you're an admin of the domain you're in.
name: kick

params.description: The node or session ID of the user you want to kick.
params.name: nodeID

description: Mutes another user's microphone for everyone. Not permanent; the silenced user can unmute themselves with the UNMUTE button in their HUD. This will only do anything if you're an admin of the domain you're in.
name: mute

params.description: The node or session ID of the user you want to mute.
params.name: nodeID

description: Request the user name and machine fingerprint associated with the given UUID. The user name will be returned in a {@link Users.usernameFromIDReply|usernameFromIDReply} signal. This will only do anything if you're an admin of the domain you're in.
name: requestUsernameFromID

params.description: The node or session ID of the user whose user name you want.
params.name: nodeID

description: Returns `true` if the DomainServer will allow this Node/Avatar to make kick.
name: getCanKick

returns.description: true if the domain server allows the client to kick (ban) other users, otherwise false.

description: Toggle the state of the space bubble feature.
name: toggleIgnoreRadius

description: Enables the space bubble feature.
name: enableIgnoreRadius

description: Disables the space bubble feature.
name: disableIgnoreRadius

description: Returns `true` if the space bubble feature is enabled.
name: getIgnoreRadiusEnabled

returns.description: true if the space bubble is enabled, otherwise false.

description: Notifies scripts that another user has entered the ignore radius.
name: enteredIgnoreRadius

description: Triggered in response to a {@link Users.requestUsernameFromID|requestUsernameFromID} call. Provides the user name and machine fingerprint associated with a UUID.Username and machineFingerprint will be their default constructor output if the requesting user isn't an admin.
name: usernameFromIDReply

description: Notifies scripts that a user has disconnected from the domain.
name: avatarDisconnected

params.description: The session ID of the avatar that has disconnected.
params.name: nodeID

The Vec3 API facilities for generating and manipulating 3-dimensional vectors. High Fidelity uses a right-handed Cartesian coordinate system where the y-axis is the "up" and the negative z-axis is the "front" direction.
name: Vec3

properties.description: { x: 1, y: 0, z: 0 } : Unit vector in the x-axis direction. Read-only.
properties.name: UNIT_X

properties.description: { x: 0, y: 1, z: 0 } : Unit vector in the y-axis direction. Read-only.
properties.name: UNIT_Y

properties.description: { x: 0, y: 0, z: 1 } : Unit vector in the z-axis direction. Read-only.
properties.name: UNIT_Z

properties.description: { x: -1, y: 0, z: 0 } : Unit vector in the negative x-axis direction. Read-only.
properties.name: UNIT_NEG_X

properties.description: { x: 0, y: -1, z: 0 } : Unit vector in the negative y-axis direction. Read-only.
properties.name: UNIT_NEG_Y

properties.description: { x: 0, y: 0, z: -1 } : Unit vector in the negative z-axis direction. Read-only.
properties.name: UNIT_NEG_Z

properties.description: { x: 0.707107, y: 0.707107, z: 0 } : Unit vector in the direction of the diagonal between the x and y axes. Read-only.
properties.name: UNIT_XY

properties.description: { x: 0.707107, y: 0, z: 0.707107 } : Unit vector in the direction of the diagonal between the x and z axes. Read-only.
properties.name: UNIT_XZ

properties.description: { x: 0, y: 0.707107, z: 0.707107 } : Unit vector in the direction of the diagonal between the y and z axes. Read-only.
properties.name: UNIT_YZ

properties.description: { x: 0.577350, y: 0.577350, z: 0.577350 } : Unit vector in the direction of the diagonal between the x, y, and z axes. Read-only.
properties.name: UNIT_XYZ

properties.description: { x: 3.402823e+38, y: 3.402823e+38, z: 3.402823e+38 } : Vector with all axis values set to the maximum floating point value. Read-only.
properties.name: FLOAT_MAX

properties.description: { x: -3.402823e+38, y: -3.402823e+38, z: -3.402823e+38 } : Vector with all axis values set to the negative of the maximum floating point value. Read-only.
properties.name: FLOAT_MIN

properties.description: { x: 0, y: 0, z: 0 } : Vector with all axis values set to 0. Read-only.
properties.name: ZERO

properties.description: { x: 1, y: 1, z: 1 } : Vector with all axis values set to 1. Read-only.
properties.name: ONE

properties.description: { x: 2, y: 2, z: 2 } : Vector with all axis values set to 2. Read-only.
properties.name: TWO

properties.description: { x: 0.5, y: 0.5, z: 0.5 } : Vector with all axis values set to 0.5. Read-only.
properties.name: HALF

properties.description: { x: 1, y: 0, z: 0 } : Unit vector in the "right" direction. Synonym for UNIT_X. Read-only.
properties.name: RIGHT

properties.description: { x: 0, y: 1, z: 0 } : Unit vector in the "up" direction. Synonym for UNIT_Y. Read-only.
properties.name: UP

properties.description: { x: 0, y: 0, z: -1 } : Unit vector in the "front" direction. Synonym for UNIT_NEG_Z. Read-only.
properties.name: FRONT

description: Calculate the reflection of a vector in a plane.
name: reflect

params.description: The vector to reflect.
params.name: v

params.description: The normal of the plane.
params.name: normal

returns.description: The vector reflected in the plane given by the normal.

examples: <caption>Reflect a vector in the x-z plane.</caption>var v = { x: 1, y: 2, z: 3 };var normal = Vec3.UNIT_Y;var reflected = Vec3.reflect(v, normal);print(JSON.stringify(reflected));  // {"x":1,"y":-2,"z":3}

description: Calculate the cross product of two vectors.
name: cross

params.description: The first vector.
params.name: v1

params.description: The second vector.
params.name: v2

returns.description: The cross product of v1 and v2.

examples: <caption>The cross product of x and y unit vectors is the z unit vector.</caption>var v1 = { x: 1, y: 0, z: 0 };var v2 = { x: 0, y: 1, z: 0 };var crossProduct = Vec3.cross(v1, v2);print(JSON.stringify(crossProduct)); // {"x":0,"y":0,"z":1}

description: Calculate the dot product of two vectors.
name: dot

params.description: The first vector.
params.name: v1

params.description: The second vector.
params.name: v2

returns.description: The dot product of v1 and v2.

examples: The dot product of vectors at right angles is 0. var v1 = { x: 1, y: 0, z: 0 }; var v2 = { x: 0, y: 1, z: 0 }; var dotProduct = Vec3.dot(v1, v2); print(dotProduct); // 0

description: Multiply a vector by a scale factor.
name: multiply

params.description: The vector.
params.name: v

params.description: The scale factor.
params.name: scale

returns.description: The vector with each ordinate value multiplied by the scale.

description: Multiply a vector by a scale factor.
name: multiply

params.description: The scale factor.
params.name: scale

params.description: The vector.
params.name: v

returns.description: The vector with each ordinate value multiplied by the scale.

description: Multiply two vectors.
name: multiplyVbyV

params.description: The first vector.
params.name: v1

params.description: The second vector.
params.name: v2

returns.description: A vector formed by multiplying the ordinates of two vectors: { x: v1.x * v2.x, y: v1.y * v2.y, z: v1.z * v2.z }.

examples: <caption>Multiply two vectors.</caption>var v1 = { x: 1, y: 2, z: 3 };var v2 = { x: 1, y: 2, z: 3 };var multiplied = Vec3.multiplyVbyV(v1, v2);print(JSON.stringify(multiplied));  // {"x":1,"y":4,"z":9}

description: Rotate a vector.
name: multiplyQbyV

params.description: The rotation to apply.
params.name: q

params.description: The vector to rotate.
params.name: v

returns.description: v rotated by q.

examples: <caption>Rotate the negative z-axis by 90 degrees about the x-axis.</caption>var v = Vec3.UNIT_NEG_Z;var q = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(90, 0, 0);var result = Vec3.multiplyQbyV(q, v);print(JSON.stringify(result));  // {"x":0,"y":1.000,"z":1.19e-7}

description: Calculate the sum of two vectors.
name: sum

params.description: The first vector.
params.name: v1

params.description: The second vector.
params.name: v2

returns.description: The sum of the two vectors.

description: Calculate one vector subtracted from another.
name: subtract

params.description: The first vector.
params.name: v1

params.description: The second vector.
params.name: v2

returns.description: The second vector subtracted from the first.

description: Calculate the length of a vector
name: length

params.description: The vector.
params.name: v

returns.description: The length of the vector.

description: Calculate the distance between two points.
name: distance

params.description: The first point.
params.name: p1

params.description: The second point.
params.name: p2

returns.description: The distance between the two points.

examples: <caption>The distance between two points is aways positive.</caption>var p1 = { x: 0, y: 0, z: 0 };var p2 = { x: 0, y: 0, z: 10 };var distance = Vec3.distance(p1, p2);print(distance); // 10p2 = { x: 0, y: 0, z: -10 };distance = Vec3.distance(p1, p2);print(distance); // 10

description: Calculate the angle of rotation from one vector onto another, with the sign depending on a reference vector.
name: orientedAngle

params.description: The first vector.
params.name: v1

params.description: The second vector.
params.name: v2

params.description: Reference vector.
params.name: ref

returns.description: The angle of rotation from the first vector to the second, in degrees, with a positive sign if the rotation axis aligns with the reference vector (has a positive dot product) otherwise a negative sign.

examples: Compare Vec3.angle() and Vec3.orientedAngle(). var v1 = { x: 5, y: 0, z: 0 }; var v2 = { x: 5, y: 0, z: 5 }; var angle = Vec3.getAngle(v1, v2); print(angle * 180 / Math.PI); // 45 print(Vec3.orientedAngle(v1, v2, Vec3.UNIT_Y)); // -45 print(Vec3.orientedAngle(v1, v2, Vec3.UNIT_NEG_Y)); // 45 print(Vec3.orientedAngle(v1, v2, { x: 1, y: 2, z: -1 })); // -45 print(Vec3.orientedAngle(v1, v2, { x: 1, y: -2, z: -1 })); // 45

description: Normalize a vector so that its length is 1.
name: normalize

params.description: The vector to normalize.
params.name: v

returns.description: The vector normalized to have a length of 1.

examples: <caption>Normalize a vector.</caption>var v = { x: 10, y: 10, z: 0 };var normalized = Vec3.normalize(v);print(JSON.stringify(normalized));  // {"x":0.7071,"y":0.7071,"z":0}print(Vec3.length(normalized));  // 1

description: Calculate a linear interpolation between two vectors.
name: mix

params.description: The first vector.
params.name: v1

params.description: The second vector.
params.name: v2

params.description: The interpolation factor in the range 0.0 to 1.0.
params.name: factor

returns.description: The linear interpolation between the two vectors: (1 - factor) * v1 + factor * v2.

examples: <caption>Linear interpolation between two vectors.</caption>var v1 = { x: 10, y: 0, z: 0 };var v2 = { x: 0, y: 10, z: 0 };var interpolated = Vec3.mix(v1, v2, 0.75);  // 1/4 of v1 and 3/4 of v2.print(JSON.stringify(interpolated));  // {"x":2.5,"y":7.5","z":0}

description: Print to the program log a text label followed by a vector value.
name: print

params.description: The label to print.
params.name: label

params.description: The vector value to print.
params.name: v

examples: <caption>Two ways of printing a label and vector value.</caption>var v = { x: 1, y: 2, z: 3 };Vec3.print("Vector: ", v);  // dvec3(1.000000, 2.000000, 3.000000)print("Vector: " + JSON.stringify(v));  // {"x":1,"y":2,"z":3}

description: Test whether two vectors are equal. Note: The vectors must be exactly equal in order for true to be returned; it is often better to use {@link Vec3(0).withinEpsilon|withinEpsilon}.
name: equal

params.description: The first vector.
params.name: v1

params.description: The second vector.
params.name: v2

returns.description: true if the two vectors are exactly equal, otherwise false.

examples: <caption> Vectors are only equal if exactly the same.</caption>var v1 = { x: 10, y: 10, z: 10 };var v2 = { x: 10, y: 10, z: 10 };var equal = Vec3.equal(v1, v2);print(equal);  // truev2 = { x: 10, y: 10, z: 10.0005 };equal = Vec3.equal(v1, v2);print(equal);  // false

description: Test whether two vectors are equal within a tolerance. Note: It is often better to use this function than {@link Vec3(0).equal|equal}.
name: withinEpsilon

params.description: The first vector.
params.name: v1

params.description: The second vector.
params.name: v2

params.description: The maximum distance between the two vectors.
params.name: epsilon

returns.description: true if the distance between the points represented by the vectors is less than or equal to the epsilon, otherwise false.

examples: <caption>Testing vectors for near equality.</caption>var v1 = { x: 10, y: 10, z: 10 };var v2 = { x: 10, y: 10, z: 10.0005 };var equal = Vec3.equal(v1, v2);print(equal);  // falseequal = Vec3.withinEpsilon(v1, v2, 0.001);print(equal);  // true

description: Calculate polar coordinates (elevation, azimuth, radius) that transform the unit z-axis vector onto a point.
name: toPolar

params.description: The point to calculate the polar coordinates for.
params.name: p

returns.description: Vector of polar coordinates for the point: x elevation rotation about the x-axis in radians, y azimuth rotation about the y-axis in radians, and z scale.

examples: <caption>Polar coordinates for a point.</caption>var v = { x: 5, y: 2.5, z: 5 };var polar = Vec3.toPolar(v);print("Elevation: " + polar.x * 180 / Math.PI);  // -19.471print("Azimuth: " + polar.y * 180 / Math.PI);  // 45print("Radius: " + polar.z);  // 7.5

description: Calculate the coordinates of a point from polar coordinate transformation of the unit z-axis vector.
name: fromPolar

params.description: The polar coordinates of a point: x elevation rotation about the x-axis in radians, y azimuth rotation about the y-axis in radians, and z scale.
params.name: polar

returns.description: The coordinates of the point.

examples: <caption>Polar coordinates to Cartesian.</caption>var polar = { x: -19.471 * Math.PI / 180, y: 45 * Math.PI / 180, z: 7.5 };var p = Vec3.fromPolar(polar);print(JSON.stringify(p));  // {"x":5,"y":2.5,"z":5}

description: Calculate the unit vector corresponding to polar coordinates elevation and azimuth transformation of the unit z-axis vector.
name: fromPolar

params.description: Rotation about the x-axis, in radians.
params.name: elevation

params.description: Rotation about the y-axis, in radians.
params.name: azimuth

returns.description: Unit vector for the direction specified by elevation and azimuth.

examples: <caption>Polar coordinates to Cartesian.</caption>var elevation = -19.471 * Math.PI / 180;var rotation = 45 * Math.PI / 180;var p = Vec3.fromPolar(elevation, rotation);print(JSON.stringify(p));  // {"x":0.667,"y":0.333,"z":0.667}p = Vec3.multiply(7.5, p);print(JSON.stringify(p));  // {"x":5,"y":2.5,"z":5}

description: Calculate the angle between two vectors.
name: getAngle

params.description: The first vector.
params.name: v1

params.description: The second vector.
params.name: v2

returns.description: The angle between the two vectors, in radians.

examples: <caption>Calculate the angle between two vectors.</caption>var v1 = { x: 10, y: 0, z: 0 };var v2 = { x: 0, y: 0, z: 10 };var angle = Vec3.getAngle(v1, v2);print(angle * 180 / Math.PI);  // 90

description:
How an entity is billboarded.

ValueDescription
noneThe entity will not be billboarded.
yawThe entity will yaw, but not pitch, to face the camera. Its actual rotation will be ignored.
fullThe entity will be billboarded to face the camera. Its actual rotation will be ignored.

description:
An entity may collide with the following types of items:

ValueDescription
1Static entities — non-dynamic entities with no velocity.
2Dynamic entities — entities that have their dynamic property set to true.
4Kinematic entities — non-dynamic entities with velocity.
8My avatar.
16Other avatars.

The values for the collision types that are enabled are added together to give the CollisionMask value. For example, a value of 31 means that an entity will collide with all item types.
name: CollisionMask

properties.description: The type of event: "Press", "DoublePress", "Release", or "Move".
properties.name: type

properties.description: Integer number used to identify the pointer: 0 = hardware mouse, 1 = left controller, 2 = right controller.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The 2D position of the event on the intersected overlay or entity XY plane, where applicable.
properties.name: pos2D

properties.description: The 3D position of the event on the intersected overlay or entity, where applicable.
properties.name: pos3D

properties.description: The surface normal at the intersection point.
properties.name: normal

properties.description: The direction of the intersection ray.
properties.name: direction

properties.description: The name of the button pressed: None, Primary, Secondary, or Tertiary.
properties.name: button

properties.description: true if the button pressed was the primary button, otherwise undefined;
properties.name: isPrimaryButton

properties.description: true if the button pressed was the primary button, otherwise undefined;
properties.name: isLeftButton

properties.description: true if the button pressed was the secondary button, otherwise undefined;
properties.name: isSecondaryButton

properties.description: true if the button pressed was the secondary button, otherwise undefined;
properties.name: isRightButton

properties.description: true if the button pressed was the tertiary button, otherwise undefined;
properties.name: isTertiaryButton

properties.description: true if the button pressed was the tertiary button, otherwise undefined;
properties.name: isMiddleButton

properties.name: isPrimaryHeld

properties.description: true if the secondary button is currently being pressed, otherwise false
properties.name: isSecondaryHeld

properties.description: true if the tertiary button is currently being pressed, otherwise false
properties.name: isTertiaryHeld

properties.description: Integer value with bits set according to which keyboard modifier keys were    pressed when the event was generated.
properties.name: keyboardModifiers

description:
A KeyboardModifiers value is used to specify which modifier keys on the keyboard are pressed. The value is the sum (bitwise OR) of the relevant combination of values from the following table:

KeyHexadecimal valueDecimal valueDescription
Shift0x0200000033554432 A Shift key on the keyboard is pressed.
Control0x0400000067108864 A control key on the keyboard is pressed. On Windows the "control" key is the Ctrl key; on OSX it is the Command key.
Alt0x08000000134217728 An Alt key on the keyboard is pressed.
Meta0x10000000268435456 A meta key on the keyboard is pressed. On Windows the "meta" key is the Windows key; on OSX it is the Control (Splat) key.
Keypad0x20000000536870912 A keypad button is pressed.
Group0x400000001073741824 X11 operating system only: An AltGr / Mode_switch key on the keyboard is pressed.
name: KeyboardModifiers

description: A 2-dimensional vector.
name: Vec2

properties.description: X-coordinate of the vector. Synonyms: u.
properties.name: x

properties.description: Y-coordinate of the vector. Synonyms: v.
properties.name: y

examples: <caption>Vec2s can be set in multiple ways and modified with their aliases, but still stringify in the same way</caption>Entities.editEntity(<id>, { materialMappingPos: { x: 0.1, y: 0.2 }});          // { x: 0.1, y: 0.2 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { materialMappingPos: { u: 0.3, v: 0.4 }});          // { x: 0.3, y: 0.4 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { materialMappingPos: [0.5, 0.6] });                 // { x: 0.5, y: 0.6 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { materialMappingPos: 0.7 });                        // { x: 0.7, y: 0.7 }var color = Entities.getEntityProperties(<id>).materialMappingPos;             // { x: 0.7, y: 0.7 }color.v = 0.8;                                                                 // { x: 0.7, y: 0.8 }

description: A 3-dimensional vector. See also the {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3} object.
name: Vec3

properties.description: X-coordinate of the vector. Synonyms: r, red.
properties.name: x

properties.description: Y-coordinate of the vector. Synonyms: g, green.
properties.name: y

properties.description: Z-coordinate of the vector. Synonyms: b, blue.
properties.name: z

examples: <caption>Vec3s can be set in multiple ways and modified with their aliases, but still stringify in the same way</caption>Entities.editEntity(<id>, { position: { x: 1, y: 2, z: 3 }});                 // { x: 1, y: 2, z: 3 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { position: { r: 4, g: 5, b: 6 }});                 // { x: 4, y: 5, z: 6 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { position: { red: 7, green: 8, blue: 9 }});        // { x: 7, y: 8, z: 9 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { position: [10, 11, 12] });                        // { x: 10, y: 11, z: 12 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { position: 13 });                                  // { x: 13, y: 13, z: 13 }var position = Entities.getEntityProperties(<id>).position;                   // { x: 13, y: 13, z: 13 }position.g = 14;                                                              // { x: 13, y: 14, z: 13 }position.blue = 15;                                                           // { x: 13, y: 14, z: 15 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { position: "red"});                                // { x: 255, y: 0, z: 0 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { position: "#00FF00"});                            // { x: 0, y: 255, z: 0 }

description: A color vector. See also the {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3} object.
name: Color

properties.description: Red component value. Integer in the range 0 - 255. Synonyms: r, x.
properties.name: red

properties.description: Green component value. Integer in the range 0 - 255. Synonyms: g, y.
properties.name: green

properties.description: Blue component value. Integer in the range 0 - 255. Synonyms: b, z.
properties.name: blue

examples: <caption>Colors can be set in multiple ways and modified with their aliases, but still stringify in the same way</caption>Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: { x: 1, y: 2, z: 3 }});                 // { red: 1, green: 2, blue: 3 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: { r: 4, g: 5, b: 6 }});                 // { red: 4, green: 5, blue: 6 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: { red: 7, green: 8, blue: 9 }});        // { red: 7, green: 8, blue: 9 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: [10, 11, 12] });                        // { red: 10, green: 11, blue: 12 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: 13 });                                  // { red: 13, green: 13, blue: 13 }var color = Entities.getEntityProperties(<id>).color;                      // { red: 13, green: 13, blue: 13 }color.g = 14;                                                              // { red: 13, green: 14, blue: 13 }color.blue = 15;                                                           // { red: 13, green: 14, blue: 15 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: "red"});                                // { red: 255, green: 0, blue: 0 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: "#00FF00"});                            // { red: 0, green: 255, blue: 0 }

description: A color vector. See also the {@link Vec3(0)|Vec3} object.

properties.name: red

properties.description: Green component value. Real in the range 0 - 255. Synonyms: g, y.
properties.name: green

properties.description: Blue component value. Real in the range 0 - 255. Synonyms: b, z.
properties.name: blue

examples: <caption>ColorFloats can be set in multiple ways and modified with their aliases, but still stringify in the same way</caption>Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: { x: 1, y: 2, z: 3 }});                 // { red: 1, green: 2, blue: 3 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: { r: 4, g: 5, b: 6 }});                 // { red: 4, green: 5, blue: 6 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: { red: 7, green: 8, blue: 9 }});        // { red: 7, green: 8, blue: 9 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: [10, 11, 12] });                        // { red: 10, green: 11, blue: 12 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: 13 });                                  // { red: 13, green: 13, blue: 13 }var color = Entities.getEntityProperties(<id>).color;                      // { red: 13, green: 13, blue: 13 }color.g = 14;                                                              // { red: 13, green: 14, blue: 13 }color.blue = 15;                                                           // { red: 13, green: 14, blue: 15 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: "red"});                                // { red: 255, green: 0, blue: 0 }Entities.editEntity(<id>, { color: "#00FF00"});                            // { red: 0, green: 255, blue: 0 }
